brzaccVLUnitHwVersion.name: brzaccVLUnitHwVersion
brzaccVLUnitHwVersion.description: Applicable to all units. Hardware platform version.

brzaccVLRunningSoftwareVersion.name: brzaccVLRunningSoftwareVersion
brzaccVLRunningSoftwareVersion.description: Applicable to all units. Running software version.

brzaccVLRunningFrom.name: brzaccVLRunningFrom
brzaccVLRunningFrom.description: Applicable to all units. The memory (main or shadow) from which the current version is running from.

brzaccVLMainVersionNumber.name: brzaccVLMainVersionNumber
brzaccVLMainVersionNumber.description: Applicable to all units. Main software version number.

brzaccVLMainVersionFileName.name: brzaccVLMainVersionFileName
brzaccVLMainVersionFileName.description: Applicable to all units. Main software version file name.

brzaccVLShadowVersionNumber.name: brzaccVLShadowVersionNumber
brzaccVLShadowVersionNumber.description: Applicable to all units. Shadow software version number.

brzaccVLShadowVersionFileName.name: brzaccVLShadowVersionFileName
brzaccVLShadowVersionFileName.description: Applicable to all units. Shadow software version file name.

brzaccVLUnitMacAddress.name: brzaccVLUnitMacAddress
brzaccVLUnitMacAddress.description: Applicable to all units. Unit hardware MAC address.

brzaccVLUnitType.name: brzaccVLUnitType
brzaccVLUnitType.description: Applicable to all units. auBS (1) : AU-BS (modular access unit). auSA (2) : AU-SA (stand-alone access unit). su-6-1D (3) : SU-6-1D (subscriber unit supporting 6 Mbps) Starting with 5.0 this is deprecated. When a SU-6-1D is upgraded to 5.0, its type will be changed to SU-6-BD. su-6-BD (4) : SU-6-BD (subscriber unit supporting 6 Mbps). su-24-BD (5) : SU-24-BD (subscriber unit supporting 24 Mbps). bu-B14 (6) : BU-B14 (BreezeNET Base Unit supporting 14 Mbps). bu-B28 (7) : BU-B28 (BreezeNET Base Unit supporting 28 Mbps). rb-B14 (8) : RB-B14 (BreezeNET Remote Bridge supporting 14 Mbps). rb-B28 (9) : RB-B28 (BreezeNET Remote Bridge supporting 28 Mbps). su-BD (10) : SU-BD (subscriber unit). su-54-BD(11) : SU-54-BD (subscriber unit supporting 54 Mbps). su-3-1D (12) : SU-3-1D (subscriber unit supporting 3 Mbps). Starting with 5.0 this is deprecated. When a SU-3-1D is upgraded to 5.0, its type will be changed to SU-3-BD. su-3-4D (13) : SU-3-4D (subscriber unit supporting 3 Mbps). Starting with 5.0 SW version this unit will work in BD mode ausBS (14) : AUS-BS (modular access unit supporting maxim 25 (via licensing) subscribers and allowing association only with SU-3 or SU-6). ausSA (15) : AUS-SA (stand-alone access unit supporting maxim 25 (via licensing) subscribers and allowing association only with SU-3 or SU-6 ). auBS4900(16) : AU-BS-4900 (BreezeAccess 4900 modular access unit) auSA4900(17) : AU-SA-4900 (BreezeAccess 4900 stand alone access unit) suBD4900(18) : SU-BD-4900 (BreezeAccess 4900 subscriber unit) bu-B100 (19) : BU-B100 (BreezeNET Base Unit unlimited throughput) rb-B100 (20) : BU-B100 (BreezeNET Remote Bridge unlimited throughput) su-I (21) : SU-I au-EZ (22) : AU-EZ su-EZ (23) : SU-EZ su-V (24) : SU-V (subscriber unit supporting 12 Mbps downlink and 8 Mbps uplink ). bu-B10(25) : BU-B10 (BreezeNET Base Unit supporting 5 Mbps). rb-B10 (26) : RB-B10 (BreezeNET Base Unit supporting 5 Mbps). su-8-BD (27) : SU-8-BD (subscriber unit supporting 8 Mbps). su-1-BD (28) : SU-1-BD (subscriber unit supporting 1 Mbps). su-3-L (29) : SU-3-L (subscriber unit supporting 3 Mbps). su-6-L (30) : SU-6-L (subscriber unit supporting 6 Mbps). su-12-L (31) : SU-12-L (subscriber unit supporting 12 Mbps). au (32) : AU (security access unit). su (33) : SU (security subscriber unit).

brzaccVLAssociatedAU.name: brzaccVLAssociatedAU
brzaccVLAssociatedAU.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Associated AU/BU MAC address.

brzaccVLNumOfAssociationsSinceLastReset.name: brzaccVLNumOfAssociationsSinceLastReset
brzaccVLNumOfAssociationsSinceLastReset.description: Applicable to all units. The number of associations since last reset, including duplicate associations (re-associations).

brzaccVLCurrentNumOfAssociations.name: brzaccVLCurrentNumOfAssociations
brzaccVLCurrentNumOfAssociations.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The number of SUs currently associated with the AU. BreezeNET-B products return 65535.

brzaccVLUnitBootVersion.name: brzaccVLUnitBootVersion
brzaccVLUnitBootVersion.description: Applicable to all units. Boot version.

brzaccVLRadioBand.name: brzaccVLRadioBand
brzaccVLRadioBand.description: Applicable to all units. The unit's radio band.

brzaccVLCurrentEthernetPortState.name: brzaccVLCurrentEthernetPortState
brzaccVLCurrentEthernetPortState.description: Applicable to all units. The current Ethernet port state.

brzaccVLTimeSinceLastReset.name: brzaccVLTimeSinceLastReset
brzaccVLTimeSinceLastReset.description: Applicable to all units. The elapsed time since last reset.

brzaccVLCountryCode.name: brzaccVLCountryCode
brzaccVLCountryCode.description: Applicable to all units. The country code and country name or country group name that is supported by the unit.

brzaccVLCountryDependentParamsTable.name: brzaccVLCountryDependentParamsTable
brzaccVLCountryDependentParamsTable.description: Applicable to all units. A table of country dependent parameters.

brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterEntry.name: brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterEntry
brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterEntry.description: Applicable to all units. An entry in the Country Dependent Parameters table.

brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterTableId.name: brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterTableIdx
brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterTableId.description: Applicable to all units. The sub-band ID of the entry in the Country Dependent Parameters table. Serves also as index for the table entry.

brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterFrequen.name: brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterFrequencies
brzaccVLCountryDependentParameterFrequen.description: Applicable to all units. The frequencies included in the applicable sub-band entry.

brzaccVLAllowedBandwidth.name: brzaccVLAllowedBandwidth
brzaccVLAllowedBandwidth.description: Applicable to all units. The bandwidth when using the applicable the sub-band.

brzaccVLRegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaPor.name: brzaccVLRegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaPort
brzaccVLRegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaPor.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum allowed Tx power when using the applicable sub-band. A RegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaPort of 255, means no limit

brzaccVLRegulationMaxEIRP.name: brzaccVLRegulationMaxEIRP
brzaccVLRegulationMaxEIRP.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum Tx EIRP when using the applicable sub-band. A Regulation Max EIRP of 0, means no limit.

brzaccVLMinModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLMinModulationLevel
brzaccVLMinModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units. The minimum supported modulation level.

brzaccVLMaxModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLMaxModulationLevel
brzaccVLMaxModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum supported modulation level.

brzaccVLBurstModeSupport.name: brzaccVLBurstModeSupport
brzaccVLBurstModeSupport.description: Applicable to all units. The supported Burst Mode Option.

brzaccVLMaximumBurstDuration.name: brzaccVLMaximumBurstDuration
brzaccVLMaximumBurstDuration.description: Applicable to all units. Applicable only if Burst Mode Option is supported. The maximum supported burst duration.

brzaccVLDfsSupport.name: brzaccVLDfsSupport
brzaccVLDfsSupport.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The supported Dfs Option.

brzaccVLMinimumHwRevision.name: brzaccVLMinimumHwRevision
brzaccVLMinimumHwRevision.description: Applicable to all units. The Minimum HW Revision needed to support the country code.

brzaccVLAuthenticationEncryptionSupport.name: brzaccVLAuthenticationEncryptionSupport
brzaccVLAuthenticationEncryptionSupport.description: Applicable to all units. The supported Authentication Encryption Option.

brzaccVLDataEncryptionSupport.name: brzaccVLDataEncryptionSupport
brzaccVLDataEncryptionSupport.description: Applicable to all units. The supported Data Encryption Option.

brzaccVLAESEncryptionSupport.name: brzaccVLAESEncryptionSupport
brzaccVLAESEncryptionSupport.description: Applicable to all units. The supported AES Encryption Option.

brzaccVLAntennaGainChange.name: brzaccVLAntennaGainChange
brzaccVLAntennaGainChange.description: Applicable to all units. Indicates whether the Antenna Gain parameter is changeable or fixed.

brzaccVLAteTestResults.name: brzaccVLAteTestResults
brzaccVLAteTestResults.description: Applicable to all units. Results of ATE Test

brzaccVLSerialNumber.name: brzaccVLSerialNumber
brzaccVLSerialNumber.description: Applicable to all units. Serial Number of the unit

brzaccVLAUSSupportSU54.name: brzaccVLAUSSupportSU54
brzaccVLAUSSupportSU54.description: Applicable to AU only. If the AU is not AUS, it will return 255. If the AUS is in 900 MHz bandwidth, it will return 255 Indicates if the AUS has license for association of SU-54.

brzaccVLNumOfRejectionsSinceLastReset.name: brzaccVLNumOfRejectionsSinceLastReset
brzaccVLNumOfRejectionsSinceLastReset.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The number of subscribers that were rejected because of wrong ESSID

brzaccVLAUSSupportSU8.name: brzaccVLAUSSupportSU8
brzaccVLAUSSupportSU8.description: Applicable to AU only. If the AU is not AUS, it will return 255. If the unit is AUS but not operating in 900 MHz, it will return 255. Indicates if the AUS has license for association of SU-8.

brzaccVLResetUnit.name: brzaccVLResetUnit
brzaccVLResetUnit.description: Applicable to all units. Resets the unit and applies new parameter values.

brzaccVLSetDefaults.name: brzaccVLSetDefaults
brzaccVLSetDefaults.description: Applicable to all units. Sets unit configuration to Defaults values after the next reset. noDefaultSettingRequested : Read-Only Option, no Default setting was Issued. completeFactory : All parameters revert to Factory Defaults values. partialFactory : All parameters revert to Factory Defaults values, except the parameters required for maintaining wireless connectivity. completeOperator: All parameters revert to Operator Defaults values. partialOperator : All parameters revert to Operator Defaults values, except the parameters required for maintaining wireless connectivity. cancelCurrentPendingRequest : Default Setting request is cancelled.

brzaccVLUnitName.name: brzaccVLUnitName
brzaccVLUnitName.description: Applicable to all units. The unit name. A string of up to 32 printable ASCII characters.

brzaccVLFlashMemoryControl.name: brzaccVLFlashMemoryControl
brzaccVLFlashMemoryControl.description: Applicable to all units. resetAndBootFromShadowVersion : Activates the backup version. useRunningVersionAfterReset : The currently active version will become the main version and will be activated after next reset.

brzaccVLTelnetLogoutTimer.name: brzaccVLTelnetLogoutTimer
brzaccVLTelnetLogoutTimer.description: Applicable to all units. Time-out of management via Telnet program. Automatic exit if the program is inactive for the defined time. Range: 1 to 999 (minutes).

brzaccVLSaveCurrentConfigurationAsOperat.name: brzaccVLSaveCurrentConfigurationAsOperatorDefaults
brzaccVLSaveCurrentConfigurationAsOperat.description: Applicable to all units. Saves the current configuration as Operator Defaults. Cannot be executed after requesting set defaults and the unit was not reset.

brzaccVLExitTelnet.name: brzaccVLExitTelnet
brzaccVLExitTelnet.description: Applicable to all units. Exit the management via Telnet program.

brzaccVLReadOnlyPassword.name: brzaccVLReadOnlyPassword
brzaccVLReadOnlyPassword.description: Applicable to all units. The User (read only) password. This is also the Read Community String. Up to 8 printable ASCII characters.

brzaccVLInstallerPassword.name: brzaccVLInstallerPassword
brzaccVLInstallerPassword.description: Applicable to all units. The Installer password. Up to 8 printable ASCII characters. Value read will allwais be *********

brzaccVLAdminPassword.name: brzaccVLAdminPassword
brzaccVLAdminPassword.description: Applicable to all units. The Administrator password. Value read will allwais be *********. Up to 8 printable ASCII characters.

brzaccVLEthernetNegotiationMode.name: brzaccVLEthernetNegotiationMode
brzaccVLEthernetNegotiationMode.description: Applicable to all units. The speed/duplex mode of the Ethernet port.

brzaccVLFTPServerUserName.name: brzaccVLFTPServerUserName
brzaccVLFTPServerUserName.description: Applicable to all units. The user name to be used for access to the FTP server. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community String (administrator password).

brzaccVLFTPServerPassword.name: brzaccVLFTPServerPassword
brzaccVLFTPServerPassword.description: Applicable to all units. The password to be used for access to the FTP server. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community String (administrator password).

brzaccVLFTPClientIPAddress.name: brzaccVLFTPClientIPAddress
brzaccVLFTPClientIPAddress.description: Applicable to all units. For SW version higher than 4.0 this is read-only. The IP address of the FTP stack in the unit.

brzaccVLFTPServerIpAddress.name: brzaccVLFTPServerIpAddress
brzaccVLFTPServerIpAddress.description: Applicable to all units. The IP address of the FTP server.

brzaccVLFTPClientMask.name: brzaccVLFTPClientMask
brzaccVLFTPClientMask.description: Applicable to all units. Starting with 5.0 this parameter is not appplicable. The Mask of the FTP stack in the unit.

brzaccVLFTPGatewayIpAddress.name: brzaccVLFTPGatewayIpAddress
brzaccVLFTPGatewayIpAddress.description: Applicable to all units. Starting with 5.0 this parameter is not appplicable. The FTP Gateway address

brzaccVLFTPSwFileName.name: brzaccVLFTPSwFileName
brzaccVLFTPSwFileName.description: Applicable to all units. The name of the SW file to be downloaded.

brzaccVLFTPSwSourceDir.name: brzaccVLFTPSwSourceDir
brzaccVLFTPSwSourceDir.description: Applicable to all units. The source directory of the required file in the FTP server. Up to 80 printable ASCII characters. Use dot (.) To clear field

brzaccVLFTPDownloadSwFile.name: brzaccVLFTPDownloadSwFile
brzaccVLFTPDownloadSwFile.description: Applicable to all units. Execution of the SW download operation

brzaccVLConfigurationFileName.name: brzaccVLConfigurationFileName
brzaccVLConfigurationFileName.description: Applicable to all units. The name of the configuration file to be downloaded/uploaded.

brzaccVLOperatorDefaultsFileName.name: brzaccVLOperatorDefaultsFileName
brzaccVLOperatorDefaultsFileName.description: Applicable to all units. The name of the Operator Defaults file to be downloaded/uploaded

brzaccVLFTPConfigurationFileSourceDir.name: brzaccVLFTPConfigurationFileSourceDir
brzaccVLFTPConfigurationFileSourceDir.description: Applicable to all units. The source directory of the required file in the FTP server. Up to 80 printable ASCII characters. Use dot (.) To clear field

brzaccVLExecuteFTPConfigurationFileLoadi.name: brzaccVLExecuteFTPConfigurationFileLoading
brzaccVLExecuteFTPConfigurationFileLoadi.description: Applicable to all units. Execution of the file download/upload operation.

brzaccVLEventLogFileName.name: brzaccVLEventLogFileName
brzaccVLEventLogFileName.description: Applicable to all units. The name of the Event Log file to be uploaded.

brzaccVLEventLogDestinationDir.name: brzaccVLEventLogDestinationDir
brzaccVLEventLogDestinationDir.description: Applicable to all units. The destination directory of the event log file. Up to 80 printable ASCII characters. Use dot (.) To clear field.

brzaccVLUploadEventLogFile.name: brzaccVLUploadEventLogFile
brzaccVLUploadEventLogFile.description: Applicable to all units. Execution of the event log upload operation.

brzaccVLLoadingStatus.name: brzaccVLLoadingStatus
brzaccVLLoadingStatus.description: Applicable to all units. The status of the last loading operation.

brzaccVLEventLogPolicy.name: brzaccVLEventLogPolicy
brzaccVLEventLogPolicy.description: Applicable to all units. The lowest level event to be registered in the event log.

brzaccVLEraseEventLog.name: brzaccVLEraseEventLog
brzaccVLEraseEventLog.description: Applicable to all units. Erase the event log.

brzaccVLSystemLocation.name: brzaccVLSystemLocation
brzaccVLSystemLocation.description: Applicable to all units. The unit location.

brzaccVLFeatureUpgradeManually.name: brzaccVLFeatureUpgradeManually
brzaccVLFeatureUpgradeManually.description: Applicable to all units. Upgrade unit to support new feature. Enter your license number (32 to 64 hex digits).

brzaccVLChangeUnitType.name: brzaccVLChangeUnitType
brzaccVLChangeUnitType.description: Applicable RB/BU only. Change the unit type between BU and RB.

brzaccVLApWorkingMode.name: brzaccVLApWorkingMode
brzaccVLApWorkingMode.description: Applicable to AU-EZ only. Starting with 5.5 it is read-only. Report unit running mode: 1 - EZ mode.

brzaccVLLEDmode.name: brzaccVLLEDmode
brzaccVLLEDmode.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. Sets the operating mode of the unit LEDS

brzaccVLThresholdTable.name: brzaccVLThresholdTable
brzaccVLThresholdTable.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. A table with the settings for Threshold mode

brzaccVLThresholdTableEntry.name: brzaccVLThresholdTableEntry
brzaccVLThresholdTableEntry.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. An entry in the ThresholdTable.

brzaccVLThresholdLEDnum.name: brzaccVLThresholdLEDnum
brzaccVLThresholdLEDnum.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. The LED position and index.

brzaccVLThresholdLEDtype.name: brzaccVLThresholdLEDtype
brzaccVLThresholdLEDtype.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. The type of measurement of the LED

brzaccVLThresholdLEDmode.name: brzaccVLThresholdLEDmode
brzaccVLThresholdLEDmode.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. The condition to turn the LED on.

brzaccVLThresholdLEDtarget.name: brzaccVLThresholdLEDtarget
brzaccVLThresholdLEDtarget.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 6.0 and higher, except AU. The target value, depending on LED type, from brzaccVLThresholdLEDtype above.

brzaccVLAccessToNwMng.name: brzaccVLAccessToNwMng
brzaccVLAccessToNwMng.description: Applicable to all units. The port to be used for remote management.

brzaccVLNwMngFilter.name: brzaccVLNwMngFilter
brzaccVLNwMngFilter.description: Applicable to all units. Disables or enable on one of the ports, or on both ports, IP address based filtering of management messages (e.g. SNMP , Telnet , TFTP , DHCP).

mngIpFilterTable.name: mngIpFilterTable
mngIpFilterTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use newMngIpFilterTable instead. Applicable to all units. A Management IP Filter Table of up to 3 IP addresses of devices that are authorized to access the unit for management purposes.

mngIpFilterEntry.name: mngIpFilterEntry
mngIpFilterEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A Management IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLNwMngIpAddress.name: brzaccVLNwMngIpAddress
brzaccVLNwMngIpAddress.description: Applicable to all units. An IP address in the Management IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLNwMngIpTableIdx.name: brzaccVLNwMngIpTableIdx
brzaccVLNwMngIpTableIdx.description: Applicable to all units. A table index for an entry in the Management IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLDeleteOneNwIpAddr.name: brzaccVLDeleteOneNwIpAddr
brzaccVLDeleteOneNwIpAddr.description: Applicable to all units. 0 - cancel operation. 1..10 - Deletes a single selected entry from the Management IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLDeleteAllNwIpAddrs.name: brzaccVLDeleteAllNwIpAddrs
brzaccVLDeleteAllNwIpAddrs.description: Applicable to all units. Deletes all entries from the Management IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLAccessToNwTrap.name: brzaccVLAccessToNwTrap
brzaccVLAccessToNwTrap.description: Applicable to all units. Enables or disables sending of traps.

mngTrapTable.name: mngTrapTable
mngTrapTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use newMngTrapTable instead. Applicable to all units. A Management Trap Table of up to 10 IP addresses of stations to send traps to.

mngTrapEntry.name: mngTrapEntry
mngTrapEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A Management Trap Table entry.

brzaccVLNwMngTrapCommunity.name: brzaccVLNwMngTrapCommunity
brzaccVLNwMngTrapCommunity.description: Applicable to all units. The trap community associated with the applicable entry in the Management Trap Table. Up to 14 printable case sensitive ASCII characters.

brzaccVLNwMngTrapAddress.name: brzaccVLNwMngTrapAddress
brzaccVLNwMngTrapAddress.description: Applicable to all units. An IP address in the Management Trap Table entry.

brzaccVLNwTrapTableIdx.name: brzaccVLNwTrapTableIdx
brzaccVLNwTrapTableIdx.description: Applicable to all units. Tables Index for an entry in the Management Trap Table.

brzaccVLDeleteOneTrapAddr.name: brzaccVLDeleteOneTrapAddr
brzaccVLDeleteOneTrapAddr.description: Applicable to all units. 0 - cancel operation. 1..10 - Deletes a single selected entry from the Management Trap Table.

brzaccVLDeleteAllTrapAddrs.name: brzaccVLDeleteAllTrapAddrs
brzaccVLDeleteAllTrapAddrs.description: Applicable to all units. Deletes all entries from the Management Trap Table.

brzaccVLMngIpRangesTable.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangesTable
brzaccVLMngIpRangesTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use brzaccVLNewMngIpRangesTable instead. Applicable to all units. Table of Management IP Address Ranges

brzaccVLMngIpRangeEntry.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangeEntry
brzaccVLMngIpRangeEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A Management IP Address Ranges Table entry

brzaccVLMngIpRangeIdx.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangeIdx
brzaccVLMngIpRangeIdx.description: Applicable to all units. Index of an entry in the Management IP Address Ranges Table

brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag
brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the method of defining the range: Using Start & End Address( rangeDefinedByStartEndAddr ), or using Start Address and Mask ( rangeDefinedByStartAddrSubNetMask ).

brzaccVLMngIpRangeStart.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangeStart
brzaccVLMngIpRangeStart.description: Applicable to all units. Start Address of the range

brzaccVLMngIpRangeEnd.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangeEnd
brzaccVLMngIpRangeEnd.description: Applicable to all units. End Address of the range. Used only if brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag is rangeDefinedByStartEndAddr

brzaccVLMngIpRangeMask.name: brzaccVLMngIpRangeMask
brzaccVLMngIpRangeMask.description: Applicable to all units. End Address of the range. Used only if brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag is rangeDefinedByStartAddrMask

brzaccVLDeleteOneNwIpRange.name: brzaccVLDeleteOneNwIpRange
brzaccVLDeleteOneNwIpRange.description: Applicable to all units. 0 - cancel operation. 1..10 - Deletes a single selected entry from the Management IP Ranges Table.

brzaccVLDeleteAllNwIpRanges.name: brzaccVLDeleteAllNwIpRanges
brzaccVLDeleteAllNwIpRanges.description: Applicable to all units. Deletes all entries from the Management IP Ranges Table.

brzaccVLWi2IpAddress.name: brzaccVLWi2IpAddress
brzaccVLWi2IpAddress.description: Applicable to SU/RB unit only. The IP Address of the WIFI WIMAX unit

brzaccVLErrHandlingSetNMSId.name: brzaccVLErrHandlingSetNMSId
brzaccVLErrHandlingSetNMSId.description: Applicable to all units. The ID of the Network Management System that use Error Handling mechanism. Get request will return 0.

newMngIpFilterTable.name: newMngIpFilterTable
newMngIpFilterTable.description: Applicable to all units. A Management IP Filter Table of up to 10 IP addresses of devices that are authorized to access the unit for management purposes.

newMngIpFilterEntry.name: newMngIpFilterEntry
newMngIpFilterEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A Management IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLNewNwMngIpAddress.name: brzaccVLNewNwMngIpAddress
brzaccVLNewNwMngIpAddress.description: Applicable to all units. An IP address in the Management IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLNewNwMngIpAddressCommand.name: brzaccVLNewNwMngIpAddressCommand
brzaccVLNewNwMngIpAddressCommand.description: Applicable to all units. Supports only active(1), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6). A command for an entry in the Management IP Filter Table.

newMngTrapTable.name: newMngTrapTable
newMngTrapTable.description: Applicable to all units. A Management Trap Table of up to 10 IP addresses of stations to send traps to.

newMngTrapEntry.name: newMngTrapEntry
newMngTrapEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A Management Trap Table entry.

brzaccVLNewNwMngTrapCommunity.name: brzaccVLNewNwMngTrapCommunity
brzaccVLNewNwMngTrapCommunity.description: Applicable to all units. The trap community associated with the applicable entry in the Management Trap Table. Up to 14 printable case sensitive ASCII characters.

brzaccVLNewNwMngTrapAddress.name: brzaccVLNewNwMngTrapAddress
brzaccVLNewNwMngTrapAddress.description: Applicable to all units. An IP address in the Management Trap Table entry.

brzaccVLNewNwTrapCommand.name: brzaccVLNewNwTrapCommand
brzaccVLNewNwTrapCommand.description: Applicable to all units. Supports only active(1), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6). A command for an entry in the Management Trap Table.

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangesTable.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangesTable
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangesTable.description: Applicable to all units. Table of Management IP Address Ranges

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeEntry.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeEntry
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A Management IP Address Ranges Table entry

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeStart.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeStart
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeStart.description: Applicable to all units. Start Address of the range

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeEnd.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeEnd
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeEnd.description: Applicable to all units. End Address of the range. Used only if brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag is rangeDefinedByStartEndAddr

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeMask.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeMask
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeMask.description: Applicable to all units. End Address of the range. Used only if brzaccVLMngIpRangeFlag is rangeDefinedByStartAddrMask

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeFlag.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeFlag
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeFlag.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the method of defining the range: Using Start & End Address( rangeDefinedByStartEndAddr ), or using Start Address and Mask ( rangeDefinedByStartAddrSubNetMask ).

brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeCommand.name: brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeCommand
brzaccVLNewMngIpRangeCommand.description: Applicable to all units. Row Status in the New Management IP Address Ranges Table

brzaccVLLastTrapSequenceNumber.name: brzaccVLLastTrapSequenceNumber
brzaccVLLastTrapSequenceNumber.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Sequence Number of Last generated Trap

brzaccVLTrapHistoryTable.name: brzaccVLTrapHistoryTable
brzaccVLTrapHistoryTable.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. This table contains the last 1024 traps generated by the unit.

brzaccVLTrapHistoryEntry.name: brzaccVLTrapHistoryEntry
brzaccVLTrapHistoryEntry.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. An entry in Trap History Table.

brzaccVLTrapHistorySequenceNumber.name: brzaccVLTrapHistorySequenceNumber
brzaccVLTrapHistorySequenceNumber.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Sequence number of the trap.

brzaccVLTrapType.name: brzaccVLTrapType
brzaccVLTrapType.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. It contains the trap type.

brzaccVLTrapMacAddrParam.name: brzaccVLTrapMacAddrParam
brzaccVLTrapMacAddrParam.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. It contains the MAC Address of the trap if the trap type requires this field, otherwise it contains the NULL MAC Address.

brzaccVLTrapIntParam1.name: brzaccVLTrapIntParam1
brzaccVLTrapIntParam1.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. It contains the first variable of integer type for the trap. If from the trap definition this variable is not applicable it will be 0.

brzaccVLTrapIntParam2.name: brzaccVLTrapIntParam2
brzaccVLTrapIntParam2.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. It contains the second variable of integer type for the trap. If from the trap definition this variable is not applicable it will be 0.

brzaccVLTrapIntParam3.name: brzaccVLTrapIntParam3
brzaccVLTrapIntParam3.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. It contains the third variable of integer type for the trap. If from the trap definition this variable is not applicable it will be 0.

brzaccVLTrapStrParam.name: brzaccVLTrapStrParam
brzaccVLTrapStrParam.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. It contains the string variable of the trap if this variable exists for that trap, otherwise it will contain the empty string.

brzaccVLUnitIpAddress.name: brzaccVLUnitIpAddress
brzaccVLUnitIpAddress.description: Applicable to all units. IP address of the unit.

brzaccVLSubNetMask.name: brzaccVLSubNetMask
brzaccVLSubNetMask.description: Applicable to all units. Subnet mask of the unit.

brzaccVLDefaultGWAddress.name: brzaccVLDefaultGWAddress
brzaccVLDefaultGWAddress.description: Applicable to all units. Default gateway IP address of the unit.

brzaccVLUseDhcp.name: brzaccVLUseDhcp
brzaccVLUseDhcp.description: Applicable to all units. DHCP client mode of operation. disabled : Use regular (manual) methods to configure IP parameters. dHCP Only: Use DHCP server to configure IP parameters. automatic: Use DHCP server to configure IP parameters. If a DHCP server is not available, use manually configured values.

brzaccVLAccessToDHCP.name: brzaccVLAccessToDHCP
brzaccVLAccessToDHCP.description: Applicable to all units. The port to be used for communicating with a DHCP server.

brzaccVLRunTimeIPaddr.name: brzaccVLRunTimeIPaddr
brzaccVLRunTimeIPaddr.description: Applicable to all units. The run-time IP address. If DHCP is used the Run Time IP Address is the address given to the unit by the server. Otherwise it is the manually configured address.

brzaccVLRunTimeSubNetMask.name: brzaccVLRunTimeSubNetMask
brzaccVLRunTimeSubNetMask.description: Applicable to all units. The run-time Subnet Mask. If DHCP is used the Run Time Subnet Mask is the mask given to the unit by the server. Otherwise it is the manually configured mask.

brzaccVLRunTimeDefaultIPGateway.name: brzaccVLRunTimeDefaultIPGateway
brzaccVLRunTimeDefaultIPGateway.description: Applicable to all units. The run-time Gateway IP address. If DHCP is used the Run Time Gateway IP Address is the address given to the unit by the server. Otherwise it is the manually configured address.

brzaccVLVlanID.name: brzaccVLVlanID
brzaccVLVlanID.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. VLAN ID for data frame tagging. Applicable to Access Link only. Range: 1 to 4094. 0 - not applicable.

brzaccVLEthernetLinkType.name: brzaccVLEthernetLinkType
brzaccVLEthernetLinkType.description: Applicable to all units. VLAN support mode (Link Type). The Access Link, Extended Access Link and Extended Trunk Link options are not available for AU/BU. Service Provider Link is not available for BU/RB.

brzaccVLManagementVlanID.name: brzaccVLManagementVlanID
brzaccVLManagementVlanID.description: Applicable to all units. VLAN ID for management frame tagging. Range: 1 to 4094, 65535 for No VLAN tagging.

brzaccVLVlanForwardingSupport.name: brzaccVLVlanForwardingSupport
brzaccVLVlanForwardingSupport.description: Applicable to all units. Enables or disables the VLAN forwarding feature. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLVlanForwardingTable.name: brzaccVLVlanForwardingTable
brzaccVLVlanForwardingTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingTable instead. Applicable to all units. A VLAN Forwarding Table of up to 20 VLAN IDs of devices to which data frames are forwarded when VLAN Forwarding is Enabled. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLVlanForwardingEntry.name: brzaccVLVlanForwardingEntry
brzaccVLVlanForwardingEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A VLAN Forwarding Table entry. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLVlanForwardingTableIdx.name: brzaccVLVlanForwardingTableIdx
brzaccVLVlanForwardingTableIdx.description: Applicable to all units. A read only table index for a VLAN entry in the VLAN Forwarding Table.

brzaccVLVlanIdForwarding.name: brzaccVLVlanIdForwarding
brzaccVLVlanIdForwarding.description: Applicable to all units. The list of VLAN ID's in the VLAN ID Forwarding Table. To Remove a VLAN ID - SET the corresponding entry to 0. To Add a new VLAN ID SET an entry which is currently 0. Range : 0 to 4094

brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingTable.name: brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingTable
brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingTable.description: Applicable to all units. A VLAN Forwarding Table of up to 20 VLAN IDs of devices to which data frames are forwarded when VLAN Forwarding is Enabled. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingEntry.name: brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingEntry
brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A VLAN Forwarding Table entry. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLNewVlanIdForwarding.name: brzaccVLNewVlanIdForwarding
brzaccVLNewVlanIdForwarding.description: Applicable to all units. The list of VLAN ID's in the VLAN ID Forwarding Table. Range : 1 to 4094

brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingCommand.name: brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingCommand
brzaccVLNewVlanForwardingCommand.description: Applicable to all units. Row Status in the New VLAN Forwarding Table.

brzaccVLVlanRelayingSupport.name: brzaccVLVlanRelayingSupport
brzaccVLVlanRelayingSupport.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Enables or disables VLAN Relaying (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLVlanRelayingTable.name: brzaccVLVlanRelayingTable
brzaccVLVlanRelayingTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTable instead. Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. A VLAN Relaying Table of up to 20 VLAN IDs of devices to which data frames are relayed when VLAN Relaying is Enabled. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLVlanRelayingEntry.name: brzaccVLVlanRelayingEntry
brzaccVLVlanRelayingEntry.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. A VLAN Relaying Table entry. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLVlanRelayingTableIdx.name: brzaccVLVlanRelayingTableIdx
brzaccVLVlanRelayingTableIdx.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. A table index for a VLAN entry in the VLAN Relaying Table.

brzaccVLVlanIdRelaying.name: brzaccVLVlanIdRelaying
brzaccVLVlanIdRelaying.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The list of VLAN ID's in the VLAN ID Relaying Table. To Remove a VLAN ID - SET the corresponding entry to 0. To Add a new VLAN ID SET an entry which is currently 0. Range: 0 to 4094 , 0 - remove entry.

brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTable.name: brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTable
brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTable.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. A VLAN Relaying Table of up to 20 VLAN IDs of devices to which data frames are relayed when VLAN Relaying is Enabled. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingEntry.name: brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingEntry
brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingEntry.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. A VLAN Relaying Table entry. (applicable in Trunk and Service Provider links only).

brzaccVLNewVlanIdRelaying.name: brzaccVLNewVlanIdRelaying
brzaccVLNewVlanIdRelaying.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The list of VLAN ID's in the VLAN ID Relaying Table. Range: 1 to 4094.

brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTableCommand.name: brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTableCommand
brzaccVLNewVlanRelayingTableCommand.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Supports only active(1), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6). A command to create or destroy a VLAN entry in the VLAN Relaying Table.

brzaccVLVlanDataPriority.name: brzaccVLVlanDataPriority
brzaccVLVlanDataPriority.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Priority tagging for data frames. Applicable to Access Link only. Range: 0 to 7.

brzaccVLVlanManagementPriority.name: brzaccVLVlanManagementPriority
brzaccVLVlanManagementPriority.description: Applicable to all units. Priority tagging for management frames. Range: 0 to 7.

brzaccVLVlanPriorityThreshold.name: brzaccVLVlanPriorityThreshold
brzaccVLVlanPriorityThreshold.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable to units with SW version 3.1 or higher. Priority threshold for tagged frames received from Ethernet port. Applicable to Hybrid Link and Trunk Link only. Valid values: 0-7.

brzaccVLQinQEthertype.name: brzaccVLQinQEthertype
brzaccVLQinQEthertype.description: Applicable to AU and SU. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. The Ethernet type of the Service Provider Tag. The range is 0x8100(33024) - 0x9000(36864), 0x9100(37120), 0x9200(37376).

brzaccVLQinQProviderVlanID.name: brzaccVLQinQProviderVlanID
brzaccVLQinQProviderVlanID.description: Applicable to SU only. VLAN ID of the Service Provider Tag.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesTable.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesTable
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesTable.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. An 8-VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesEntry.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesEntry
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesEntry.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. An entry in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesTableIdx.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesTableIdx
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulesTableIdx.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. A table index for a VLAN Rule entry/rule in the VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleId.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleId
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleId.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. Identifies the VLAN Rule type of an entry/rule, in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleVlanId.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleVlanId
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleVlanId.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. Identifies the data VLAN ID of an entry/rule, in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link. Range: 1-4094. Value zero is returned if no rule defined for this entry.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulePriority.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulePriority
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRulePriority.description: Starting with version 6.0. Applicable to SU/RB units only. Identifies the Priority tagging for data frames, for an entry/rule, in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link. Range: 0-7. Value 255 is returned if no rule defined for this entry.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleMulticastA.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleMulticastAllowed
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleMulticastA.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. Determine if Multicast frames are tagged and sent on wireless LAN. Option for an entry/rule, in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link. Value 255 is returned if no rule defined for this entry.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleOpType.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleOpType
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleOpType.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. Identifies the VLAN Operand type of an entry/rule, in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link. Range: 1-4. Value 255 is returned if no rule or default rule defined for this entry. Accepted combinations are: sourceMacAddress, destinationMacAddress - value, range, mask; sourceIpAddress, destinationIpAddress - value, range, mask; sourceUdpPort, destinationUdpPort - value, range, enumeration; sourceTcpPort, destinationTcpPort - value, range, enumeration; ipProtocol - value, enumeration

brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleOperands.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleOperands
brzaccVLVlanExtendedAccessRuleOperands.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. The VLAN Operand list of an entry/rule, in VLAN Rule Table for Extended Access Link. Operand list may be one of the following: v1-v2 : range (v1 - v2), v1 and v2 included (not applicable for IP protocols); v,m : value and mask (for MAC and IP only); v0 : single value; v1,v2,v3 : max 8-value enumeration (for Ports and IP protocols only). An operand may be: xxxxxxxxxxxx : 12-char hexadecimal representation of a MAC address; ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd : max 15-char decimal representation of an IP address; ddddd : max 5-char decimal representation of a Port; ddd : max 3-char decimal representation of an IP Protocol. Up to 63 printable ASCII characters.

brzaccVLVlanExtendedTrunkVlanID.name: brzaccVLVlanExtendedTrunkVlanID
brzaccVLVlanExtendedTrunkVlanID.description: Starting with version 6.0. Available for SU/RB units only. Native VLAN ID value, for Extended Trunk Link.

brzaccVLBridgeAgingTime.name: brzaccVLBridgeAgingTime
brzaccVLBridgeAgingTime.description: Applicable to all units. Bridge aging time for devices on both the Ethernet and wireless link sides. Range: 20 to 2000 seconds.

brzaccVLBroadcastRelaying.name: brzaccVLBroadcastRelaying
brzaccVLBroadcastRelaying.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Enables/disables the relaying of broadcast messages to the wireless link.

brzaccVLUnicastRelaying.name: brzaccVLUnicastRelaying
brzaccVLUnicastRelaying.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Enables/disables the relaying of unicast messages to the wireless link.

brzaccVLEthBroadcastFiltering.name: brzaccVLEthBroadcastFiltering
brzaccVLEthBroadcastFiltering.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Enables/disables the filtering of Ethernet (layer2) broadcasts. disable : No filtering. onEthernetOnly : Filters broadcasts received on the Ethernet port only. onWirelessOnly : Filters broadcasts received on the Wlan port only. onBothWirelessAndEth: Filters broadcasts received on both ports.

brzaccVLDHCPBroadcastOverrideFilter.name: brzaccVLDHCPBroadcastOverrideFilter
brzaccVLDHCPBroadcastOverrideFilter.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Enables or disables the broadcasting of DHCP messages, overriding the general *brzaccVLEthBroadcastFiltering Ethernet broadcast filtering option.

brzaccVLPPPoEBroadcastOverrideFilter.name: brzaccVLPPPoEBroadcastOverrideFilter
brzaccVLPPPoEBroadcastOverrideFilter.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Enables or disables the broadcasting of PPPoE messages, overriding the general *brzaccVLEthBroadcastFiltering Ethernet broadcast filtering option.

brzaccVLARPBroadcastOverrideFilter.name: brzaccVLARPBroadcastOverrideFilter
brzaccVLARPBroadcastOverrideFilter.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Enables or disables the broadcasting of ARP messages, overriding the general *brzaccVLEthBroadcastFiltering Ethernet broadcast filtering option.

brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterOpti.name: brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterOption
brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterOpti.description: Applicable to all units. Enable/disable the limiter for multicast and broadcast packets.

brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterThre.name: brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterThreshold
brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterThre.description: Applicable to all units. The limit on the number of multicast and broadcast packets when the Ethernet Broadcast/Multicast Limiter Option is enabled. Range: 0 to 204800

brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterSend.name: brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterSendTrapInterval
brzaccVLEthBroadcastMulticastLimiterSend.description: Applicable to all units. The minimum time between two successive traps that are sent indicating the number of packets that were dropped by the Ethernet Broadcast/Multicast Limiter since the last trap was sent. Range: 1 to 60 minutes

brzaccVLToSPrecedenceThreshold.name: brzaccVLToSPrecedenceThreshold
brzaccVLToSPrecedenceThreshold.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable to units with SW version 3.1 or higher. Priority threshold (based on the ToS) for frames received from the Ethernet port. Range: 0 to 7.

brzaccVLRoamingOption.name: brzaccVLRoamingOption
brzaccVLRoamingOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Disable/enable the roaming feature. When enabled, the SU/RB will start scanning for an AU/BU after about one second of not receiving beacons or data from current AU/BU. Once it found a new AU/BU, it will also send through the wireless network a roaming SNAP on behalf of its clients informing other devices in the network of their new location. When disabled, it will wait for about seven seconds before starting scanning, and it will not send a roaming SNAP.

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListTable.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListTable
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListTable instead. Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. A list of up to 100 MAC Addresses of SUs. If brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction is set to denyList, these are SUs that are not allowed to transfer data to the AU. If brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction is set to allowList, only these SUs are allowed to transfer data to the AU.

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListEntry.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListEntry
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListEntry.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. An entry in the Mac Address Deny List Table.

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListTableIdx.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListTableIdx
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListTableIdx.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. A read only table index for a MAC Address entry in the Mac Address Deny List Table. Range: 1 to 100.

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListId.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListId
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListId.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. The list of MAC Addresses in the Mac Address Deny List Table. To Remove a MAC Address - SET the corresponding entry to 0. To Add a new MAC Address - SET an entry which is currently 0.

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAdd.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAdd
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAdd.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. Add a MAC address to the MAC Address Deny List Table

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListRemove.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListRemove
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListRemove.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. Delete a MAC address from the MAC Address Deny List Table

brzaccVLNumberOfMacAddressesInDenyList.name: brzaccVLNumberOfMacAddressesInDenyList
brzaccVLNumberOfMacAddressesInDenyList.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. Number of MAC addresses in the MAC Address Deny List Table.

brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction.name: brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction
brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction.description: Applicable to AU only. Define the action to be used by the Mac Address Deny List. allowedList(2) means that the list becomes Allow list.

brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListTable.name: brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListTable
brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListTable.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. A list of up to 100 MAC Addresses of SUs. If brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction is set to denyList, these are SUs that are not allowed to transfer data to the AU. If brzaccVLMacAddressDenyListAction is set to allowList, only these SUs are allowed to transfer data to the AU.

brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListEntry.name: brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListEntry
brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListEntry.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. An entry in the Mac Address Deny List Table.

brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListId.name: brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListId
brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListId.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. The list of MAC Addresses in the Mac Address Deny List Table.

brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListCommand.name: brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListCommand
brzaccVLNewMacAddressDenyListCommand.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. Supports only active(1), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6). Used for add or destroy entry.

brzaccVLEthernetPortControl.name: brzaccVLEthernetPortControl
brzaccVLEthernetPortControl.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Enable/disable the Ethernet port. When disabled, only data frames are blocked. Management frames are accepted.

brzaccVLSendBroadcastsMulticastsAsUnicas.name: brzaccVLSendBroadcastsMulticastsAsUnicasts
brzaccVLSendBroadcastsMulticastsAsUnicas.description: Applicable to BU only. When enabled the Multicast/Broadcast packets are sent by BU as Unicast packets to RB. When disabled the Multicast/Broadcast packets are sent by BU as Broadcast packets to RB

brzaccVLESSID.name: brzaccVLESSID
brzaccVLESSID.description: Applicable to all units. The Extended Service Set ID (ESSID) used to prevent the merging of collocated systems. The ESSID is accessible only with the write community string (administrator password). Up to 31 printable case sensitive ASCII characters.

brzaccVLOperatorESSIDOption.name: brzaccVLOperatorESSIDOption
brzaccVLOperatorESSIDOption.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Enabling/disabling the use of the Operator ESSID.

brzaccVLOperatorESSID.name: brzaccVLOperatorESSID
brzaccVLOperatorESSID.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. A secondary ESSID to support easy installation of SUs as well as the use of the Best AU/BU feature. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community Up to 31 printable case sensitive ASCII characters.

brzaccVLRunTimeESSID.name: brzaccVLRunTimeESSID
brzaccVLRunTimeESSID.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The ESSID of the associated AU/BU. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community. Up to 31 printable ASCII characters, case sensitive.

brzaccVLAUHiddenESSIDOption.name: brzaccVLAUHiddenESSIDOption
brzaccVLAUHiddenESSIDOption.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Enabling/disabling the use of the Hidden ESSID.

brzaccVLSUHiddenESSIDSupport.name: brzaccVLSUHiddenESSIDSupport
brzaccVLSUHiddenESSIDSupport.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Enabling/Disabling the option for an SU/RB to associate with an AU/BU that is using Hidden ESSID

brzaccVLSUHiddenESSIDTimeout.name: brzaccVLSUHiddenESSIDTimeout
brzaccVLSUHiddenESSIDTimeout.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. If an AU/BU rejects the subscribers because of worng ESSID the SU/RB will try again to associate with this AU/BU only after this period of time. The time is given in minutes

brzaccVLMaximumCellRadius.name: brzaccVLMaximumCellRadius
brzaccVLMaximumCellRadius.description: Applicable to all units. For AU/BU: read-write. In units with SW version 2.0 and up - applicable only when the Cell Distance Mode is set to Manual. The highest distance from the AU/BU of any SU/RB served by it. Affects the maximum time the units wait for a response message and the slot size by taking into account the round trip propagation delay. For SU/RB: read-only. The distance is learned from the AU/BU. Range: For units below version 2.0 the range is 0 - 50000 Meters. Otherwise - the range is 0 to 54 Kilometers. 0 means no compensation (minimum slot size, maximal delay timeout).

brzaccVLAIFS.name: brzaccVLAIFS
brzaccVLAIFS.description: Applicable to AU and SU. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Not applicable if Wireless Link Prioritization is enabled. Arbitration Inter-Frame Spacing (AIFS) value, in slots. This is the number of time slots that define the DIFS. (DIFS=SIFS+AIFS). A value of 1 should be used only in point-to-point applications to allow one unit to have advantage over the other unit.

brzaccVLWirelessTrapThreshold.name: brzaccVLWirelessTrapThreshold
brzaccVLWirelessTrapThreshold.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. A wireless link quality threshold, expressed in % of retransmissions, for sending the brzaccVLAUWirelessQualityTRAP. This trap indicate whether the quality has gone below or above the specified threshold. The Threshold Range: 1 to 100 (% retransmissions).

brzaccVLTransmitPowerTable.name: brzaccVLTransmitPowerTable
brzaccVLTransmitPowerTable.description: Applicable to all units. A table of transmit power parameters.

brzaccVLTransmitPowerEntry.name: brzaccVLTransmitPowerEntry
brzaccVLTransmitPowerEntry.description: Applicable to all units. An entry in the Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLTransmitPowerIdx.name: brzaccVLTransmitPowerIdx
brzaccVLTransmitPowerIdx.description: Applicable to all units. An index of an entry in the Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLApplicableModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLApplicableModulationLevel
brzaccVLApplicableModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units. The applicable modulation level for an entry in the Transmit Power Table. Level 8 is not applicable to units with HW revision A.

brzaccVLMaximumTxPowerRange.name: brzaccVLMaximumTxPowerRange
brzaccVLMaximumTxPowerRange.description: Applicable to all units. The allowed range for the brzaccVLTxPower parameter at the applicable modulation level . Range: -10 to the maximum allowed power level at the applicable modulation level , in dBm.

brzaccVLTxPower.name: brzaccVLTxPower
brzaccVLTxPower.description: Applicable to all units. Read-only for units with SW version 4.0 and higher. In AU/BU: The transmit power in dBm defined for the applicable rate. In SU/RB: If ATPC is disabled, this is the transmit power in dBm defined for the applicable rate. If ATPC is enabled, it serves as the initial transmit power in dBm for the ATPC algorithm. In SU/RB: The range is -10 dBm to the power value defined by brzaccVLMaximumTxPower for the applicable modulation level. In AU/BU: The range is -10 dBm to the power value defined by brzaccVLMaximumTxPowerRange for the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLCurrentTxPower.name: brzaccVLCurrentTxPower
brzaccVLCurrentTxPower.description: Applicable to SU/RB. The actual transmit power in dBm for the applicable rate. Range: -17 to the maximum value defined by brzaccVLMaximumTxPowerRange for the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLNewTransmitPowerTable.name: brzaccVLNewTransmitPowerTable
brzaccVLNewTransmitPowerTable.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 5.1 and higher A table of transmit power parameters.

brzaccVLNewTransmitPowerEntry.name: brzaccVLNewTransmitPowerEntry
brzaccVLNewTransmitPowerEntry.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 5.1 and higher An entry in the Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLNewModulationLevelIdx.name: brzaccVLNewModulationLevelIdx
brzaccVLNewModulationLevelIdx.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 5.1 and higher. An index ( and modulation level ) of an entry in the NewTransmitPowerTable.

brzaccVLNewMaximumTxPowerRange.name: brzaccVLNewMaximumTxPowerRange
brzaccVLNewMaximumTxPowerRange.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 5.1 and higher. The allowed range for the brzaccVLNewTxPower parameter at the applicable modulation level . Range: -10 to the maximum allowed power level at the applicable modulation level , in dBm.

brzaccVLNewTxPower.name: brzaccVLNewTxPower
brzaccVLNewTxPower.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 5.1 and higher. In AU/BU: The transmit power in dBm defined for the applicable rate. In SU/RB: If ATPC is disabled, this is the transmit power in dBm defined for the applicable rate. If ATPC is enabled, it serves as the initial transmit power in dBm for the ATPC algorithm. In SU/RB: The range is -10 dBm to the power value defined by brzaccVLNewMaximumTxPower for the applicable modulation level. In AU/BU: The range is -10 dBm to the power value defined by brzaccVLNewMaximumTxPowerRange for the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLNewCurrentTxPower.name: brzaccVLNewCurrentTxPower
brzaccVLNewCurrentTxPower.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 5.1 and higher. The actual transmit power in dBm for the applicable rate. Range: -17 to the maximum value defined by brzaccVLNewMaximumTxPowerRange for the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerTable.name: brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerTable
brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerTable.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. A table of maximum transmit power parameters.

brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerEntry.name: brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerEntry
brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerEntry.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. An entry in the Maximum Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerIdx.name: brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerIdx
brzaccVLMaximumTransmitPowerIdx.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. An index of an entry in the Maximum Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLMaxTxApplicableModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLMaxTxApplicableModulationLevel
brzaccVLMaxTxApplicableModulationLevel.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The applicable modulation level for an entry in the Maximum Transmit Power Table. Level 8 is not applicable to units with HW revision A.

brzaccVLDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange.name: brzaccVLDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange
brzaccVLDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The allowed range for the brzaccVLMaxTxPower parameter at the applicable modulation level . Range: -10 to the maximum allowed power level at the applicable modulation level , in dBm.

brzaccVLMaxTxPower.name: brzaccVLMaxTxPower
brzaccVLMaxTxPower.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Read-only for units with SW version 4.0 and higher. The maximum value that can be configured for the brzaccVLTxPower parameter. This is also the maximum power level that can be reached by the ATPC algorithm. The range is -10 dBm to the maximum value defined by brzaccVLDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange for the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLNewMaximumTransmitPowerTable.name: brzaccVLNewMaximumTransmitPowerTable
brzaccVLNewMaximumTransmitPowerTable.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. A table of maximum transmit power parameters.

brzaccVLNewMaximumTransmitPowerEntry.name: brzaccVLNewMaximumTransmitPowerEntry
brzaccVLNewMaximumTransmitPowerEntry.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. An entry in the Maximum Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLNewMaxModulationLevelIdx.name: brzaccVLNewMaxModulationLevelIdx
brzaccVLNewMaxModulationLevelIdx.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The applicable modulation level for an entry in the NEW Maximum Transmit Power Table. This OID also represent an index of an entry in the NEW Maximum Transmit Power Table.

brzaccVLNewDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange.name: brzaccVLNewDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange
brzaccVLNewDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The allowed range for the brzaccVLNewMaxTxPower parameter at the applicable modulation level . Range: -10 to the maximum allowed power level at the applicable modulation level , in dBm.

brzaccVLNewMaxTxPower.name: brzaccVLNewMaxTxPower
brzaccVLNewMaxTxPower.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Read-only for units with SW version 4.0 and higher. The maximum value that can be configured for the brzaccVLNewTxPower parameter. This is also the maximum power level that can be reached by the ATPC algorithm. The range is -10 dBm to the maximum value defined by brzaccVLNewDefinedMaximumTxPowerRange for the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLMaxNumOfAssociations.name: brzaccVLMaxNumOfAssociations
brzaccVLMaxNumOfAssociations.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Sets the upper limit for the number of SUs that can be associated with the AU. Range: For regular AUs (AU-BS, AU-SA, AU) the range is from 0 to 512 if encryption is disabled the range id form 0 to 124 if encryption is enabled For AUS-BS and AUS-SA with SW version 4.0 and higher the range is between 0 to 8 or 25 (via licensing). For AUS-BS and AUS-SA with SW version below 4.0 the range is between 0 to 5. BreezeNET-B products return 65535.

brzaccVLBestAuSupport.name: brzaccVLBestAuSupport
brzaccVLBestAuSupport.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Disable/enable the Best AU/BU selection mechanism.

brzaccVLBestAuNoOfScanningAttempts.name: brzaccVLBestAuNoOfScanningAttempts
brzaccVLBestAuNoOfScanningAttempts.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The number of scanning attempts to collect information for the Best AU/BU decision. Range: 1 to 255.

brzaccVLPreferredAuMacAddress.name: brzaccVLPreferredAuMacAddress
brzaccVLPreferredAuMacAddress.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The MAC address of the preferred AU/BU (overriding the Best AU/BU selection process). 000000000000 means no preferred AU/BU.

brzaccVLNeighborAuTable.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuTable
brzaccVLNeighborAuTable.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. A table of data on neighboring AUs/BUs.

brzaccVLNeighborAuEntry.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuEntry
brzaccVLNeighborAuEntry.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. An entry in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuIdx.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuIdx
brzaccVLNeighborAuIdx.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. An index of an entry in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuMacAdd.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuMacAdd
brzaccVLNeighborAuMacAdd.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. A MAC address of an AU/BU in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuESSID.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuESSID
brzaccVLNeighborAuESSID.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The ESSID of an AU/BU in the Neighbor AU/BU Table. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community.

brzaccVLNeighborAuSNR.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuSNR
brzaccVLNeighborAuSNR.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The received signal quality (SNR) in dB of an AU/BU in the Neighbor AU/BU Table. If the returned value is 255 this means that the indication is not available.

brzaccVLNeighborAuAssocLoadStatus.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuAssocLoadStatus
brzaccVLNeighborAuAssocLoadStatus.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU association load status in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuMark.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuMark
brzaccVLNeighborAuMark.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU mark in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuHwRevision.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuHwRevision
brzaccVLNeighborAuHwRevision.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU HW revision in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuCountryCode.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuCountryCode
brzaccVLNeighborAuCountryCode.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU supported country code in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuSwVer.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuSwVer
brzaccVLNeighborAuSwVer.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU SW version in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuAtpcOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuAtpcOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuAtpcOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU ATPC option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuAdapModOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuAdapModOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuAdapModOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU adaptive modulation option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuBurstModeOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuBurstModeOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuBurstModeOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU burst mode option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuDfsOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuDfsOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuDfsOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU DFS option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuConcatenationOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuConcatenationOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuConcatenationOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU concatenation option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuLearnCountryCodeBySU.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuLearnCountryCodeBySU
brzaccVLNeighborAuLearnCountryCodeBySU.description: Applicable to SU only. Starting with 4.0 is not applicable for BA4900 and BreezeNET B products. Neighbor AU Learn Country Code by SU configuration in the Neighbor AU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuSecurityMode.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuSecurityMode
brzaccVLNeighborAuSecurityMode.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU security mode configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuAuthOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuAuthOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuAuthOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU authentication option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuDataEncyptOption.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuDataEncyptOption
brzaccVLNeighborAuDataEncyptOption.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. Neighbor AU/BU data encryption option configuration in the Neighbor AU/BU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuPerSuDistanceLearning.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuPerSuDistanceLearning
brzaccVLNeighborAuPerSuDistanceLearning.description: Applicable to SU only. Neighbor AU per SU distance learning option configuration in the Neighbor AU Table.

brzaccVLNeighborAuRSSI.name: brzaccVLNeighborAuRSSI
brzaccVLNeighborAuRSSI.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The Recieved Signal Strength Indication of an AU/BU in the Neighbor AU/BU Table. If the returned value is 255 this means that the indication is not available. This value is given in dBm units.

brzaccVLSubBandLowerFrequency.name: brzaccVLSubBandLowerFrequency
brzaccVLSubBandLowerFrequency.description: Applicable to SU only. Not applicable to units with SW version 2.0 or higher. The lowest frequency in the subset to be used for scanning. For 5.8GHz products the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For 4.9GHz products the range is 4920 to 5080 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For HW Revision C and above this leaf is not relevant - shall return 0.

brzaccVLSubBandUpperFrequency.name: brzaccVLSubBandUpperFrequency
brzaccVLSubBandUpperFrequency.description: Applicable to SU only. Not applicable to units with SW version 2.0 or higher. The highest frequency in the subset to be used for scanning. For 5.8GHz products the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For 4.9GHz products the range is 4920 to 5080 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For HW Revision C and above this leaf is not relevant - shall return 0.

brzaccVLScanningStep.name: brzaccVLScanningStep
brzaccVLScanningStep.description: Applicable to all units - For flexible Sub-Bands only. For units with version 2.0 and above this is a read-only parameter. The scanning step to be used for generating the frequency subset.

brzaccVLFrequencySubsetTable.name: brzaccVLFrequencySubsetTable
brzaccVLFrequencySubsetTable.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The Frequency Subset Table that includes all frequencies from the selected Sub-band.

brzaccVLFrequencySubsetEntry.name: brzaccVLFrequencySubsetEntry
brzaccVLFrequencySubsetEntry.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. An entry in the Frequency Subset Table.

brzaccVLFrequencySubsetTableIdx.name: brzaccVLFrequencySubsetTableIdx
brzaccVLFrequencySubsetTableIdx.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. An index of an entry in the Frequency subset Table.

brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequency.name: brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequency
brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequency.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. Applicable to all units with HW revision B and lower (for units with HW revision C and higher replaced by brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequencyNew to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz). The frequency in MHz of an entry in the Frequency Subset table.

brzaccVLFrequencySubsetActive.name: brzaccVLFrequencySubsetActive
brzaccVLFrequencySubsetActive.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The status of an entry in the Frequency subset Table. The frequency of an active entry will be included in the final list of frequencies to be used for scanning.

brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequencyNew.name: brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequencyNew
brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequencyNew.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The frequency in MHz of an entry in the Frequency Subset table. (Replaces brzaccVLFrequencySubsetFrequency to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz for units with HW revision C and higher).

brzaccVLSetSelectedFreqSubset.name: brzaccVLSetSelectedFreqSubset
brzaccVLSetSelectedFreqSubset.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. Apply the selected subset. After the next reset the new subset will be used.

brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetTable.name: brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetTable
brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetTable.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The Current Frequency Subset table. In SU/RB it includes all frequencies that are currently used for scanning. In AU/BU it includes all frequencies that can be used by the DFS mechanism (if applicable)

brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetEntry.name: brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetEntry
brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetEntry.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. An entry in the Current Frequency Subset Table.

brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetTableIdx.name: brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetTableIdx
brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetTableIdx.description: Applicable to SU/RB and to AU/BU. An index of an entry in the Current Frequency subset Table. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher.

brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequency.name: brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequency
brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequency.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. Applicable to all units with HW revision B and lower (for units with HW revision C and higher replaced by brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequencyNew to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz). The frequency in MHz of an entry in the Current Frequency Subset table.

brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequencyN.name: brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequencyNew
brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequencyN.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The frequency in MHz of an entry in the Current Frequency Subset table. (Replaces brzaccVLCurrentFrequencySubsetFrequency to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz for units with HW revision C and higher).

brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequency.name: brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequency
brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequency.description: Applicable to AU/BU with HW revision B and lower (for units with HW revision C and higher replaced by brzaccVLCurrentUOperatingFrequencyNew to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz). The operating frequency in MHz. For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For units with SW version 2.0 and up the range is as defined in the selected Sub Band.

brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequency.name: brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequency
brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequency.description: Applicable to AU/BU with HW revision B and lower (for units with HW revision C and higher replaced by brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequencyNew to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz). For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 this is the frequency in MHz of the AU/BU after the next reset. For units with SW version 2.0 and up this is the frequency in MHz to use when the DFS Option is disabled. For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For units with SW version 2.0 and up the range is as defined in the selected Sub Band.

brzaccVLCurrentSUOperatingFrequency.name: brzaccVLCurrentSUOperatingFrequency
brzaccVLCurrentSUOperatingFrequency.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The frequency used currently by the unit. For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For units with SW version 2.0 and up the range is as defined in the selected Sub Band.

brzaccVLSelectSubBandIndex.name: brzaccVLSelectSubBandIndex
brzaccVLSelectSubBandIndex.description: Applicable to all units with SW version below 4.0 For units with SW version 4.0 and up it is applicable only for AU/BU. For SU/RB it defines only the sub-band for the Spectrum Analyzer. The ID of the sub-band configured in the unit. Its range depends on unit's type and Country Code.

brzaccVLDFSOption.name: brzaccVLDFSOption
brzaccVLDFSOption.description: Applicable to AU/BU. Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Enabling/disabling the DFS Algorithm. Not applicable if DFS Option is not supported by the current Sub Band.

brzaccVLDFSChannelCheckTime.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelCheckTime
brzaccVLDFSChannelCheckTime.description: Applicable to AU/BU. Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Channel Availability Check time defines the time the unit checks the channel for presence of radar signals and does not transmit after power up or association or after moving to a new channel due to detecting radar in the used channel. Range: 1 to 3600 (seconds).

brzaccVLDFSChannelAvoidancePeriod.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelAvoidancePeriod
brzaccVLDFSChannelAvoidancePeriod.description: Applicable to AU/BU. Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Defines the time after detecting radar signals in a channel of avoiding using the channel or adjacent channels in accordance with the bandwidth. Range: 1 to 60 (minutes).

brzaccVLDFSSuWaitingOption.name: brzaccVLDFSSuWaitingOption
brzaccVLDFSSuWaitingOption.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Defines whether the associated SUs should wait for this AU/BU after it stopped transmitting due to radar detection, before they starts scanning for other AUs/BUs.

brzaccVLDFSClearRadarDetectedChannelsAft.name: brzaccVLDFSClearRadarDetectedChannelsAfterReset
brzaccVLDFSClearRadarDetectedChannelsAft.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Clear Radar Detected and Adjacent to Radar channels after unit reset. Returns the unit to operate in default frequency.

brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsTable.name: brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsTable
brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsTable.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Applicable only when DFS option is on. Displays the current channels defined in the sub-band and their radar detection status.

brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsEntry.name: brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsEntry
brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsEntry.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. An entry in the brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsTable.

brzaccVLDFSChannelIdx.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelIdx
brzaccVLDFSChannelIdx.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Read-only. The index of the entry in the brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelsTable.

brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequency.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequency
brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequency.description: Applicable to AU/BU with HW revision B and lower (for units with HW revision C and higher replaced by brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequency New to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz). The frequency in MHz of a channel in the DFS Radar Detection Channels Table.

brzaccVLDFSChannelRadarStatus.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelRadarStatus
brzaccVLDFSChannelRadarStatus.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The radar detection status of a channel in brzaccVLDFSRadarDetectionChannelTable.

brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequencyNew.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequencyNew
brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequencyNew.description: Applicable to AU/BU. The frequency of a channel in the DFS Radar Detection Channels Table. (Replaces brzaccVLDFSChannelFrequency to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz for units with HW revision C and higher).

brzaccVLDFSMinimumPulsesToDetect.name: brzaccVLDFSMinimumPulsesToDetect
brzaccVLDFSMinimumPulsesToDetect.description: Applicable to AU/BU. Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Defines the minimum number of pulses to detect a radar. Range: 1 - 100.

brzaccVLDFSChannelReuseOption.name: brzaccVLDFSChannelReuseOption
brzaccVLDFSChannelReuseOption.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Enabling/disabling the DFS Channel Reuse Algorithm. Not applicable if DFS Option is not supported by the current Sub Band.

brzaccVLDFSRadarActivityAssessmentPeriod.name: brzaccVLDFSRadarActivityAssessmentPeriod
brzaccVLDFSRadarActivityAssessmentPeriod.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Range: 1 to 12 (Houres).

brzaccVLDFSMaximumNumberOfDetectionsInAs.name: brzaccVLDFSMaximumNumberOfDetectionsInAssessmentPeriod
brzaccVLDFSMaximumNumberOfDetectionsInAs.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Range: 1 to 10 (Times).

brzaccVLDFSDetectionAlgorithm.name: brzaccVLDFSDetectionAlgorithm
brzaccVLDFSDetectionAlgorithm.description: Applicable to AU/BU. Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Defines the DFS Detection Algorithm.

brzaccVLDFSRemoteRadarEventReports.name: brzaccVLDFSRemoteRadarEventReports
brzaccVLDFSRemoteRadarEventReports.description: Applicable to AU only with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Defines the number of SU radar reports for the AU to leave channel . Range: 0 - 512.

brzaccVLDFSRemoteRadarEventMonitoringPer.name: brzaccVLDFSRemoteRadarEventMonitoringPeriod
brzaccVLDFSRemoteRadarEventMonitoringPer.description: Applicable to AU only with SW version 5.5.20 and higher. Defines the interval in minutes of accumulated SU Radar Reports for the AU to leave channel. Range: 1 - 30.

brzaccVLEnhancedETSIRadarDetection.name: brzaccVLEnhancedETSIRadarDetection
brzaccVLEnhancedETSIRadarDetection.description: Applicable to AU/BU units with software version 5.5.27.1 and higher.

brzaccVLCountryCodeLearningBySU.name: brzaccVLCountryCodeLearningBySU
brzaccVLCountryCodeLearningBySU.description: Applicable to AU only. Starting with 4.0 it is not applicable for BA4900 and BreezeNET B. Defines whether the SUs learn the country code of the AU.

brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequencyNew.name: brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequencyNew
brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequencyNew.description: Applicable to AU/BU. The operating frequency in MHz. (Replaces brzaccVLCurrentAUOperatingFrequency to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz for units with HW revision C and higher). For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For units with SW version 2.0 and up the range is as defined in the selected Sub Band.

brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequencyNew.name: brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequencyNew
brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequencyNew.description: Applicable to AU/BU. For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 this is the frequency in MHz of the AU/BU after the next reset. For units with SW version 2.0 and up this is the frequency in MHz to use when the DFS Option is disabled. (Replaces brzaccVLAUDefinedFrequency to support a resolution of 0.5 MHz for units with HW revision C and higher). For 5.8GHz products with SW version below 2.0 the range is 5740 to 5830 MHz using 10MHz resolution. For units with SW version 2.0 and up the range is as defined in the selected Sub Band.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandSelectedFreqSubset.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandSelectedFreqSubset
brzaccVLAutoSubBandSelectedFreqSubset.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. Apply the selected subset. After the next reset the new subset will be used for scanning.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetTable.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetTable
