brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetTable.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The Frequency Subset Table that includes all available sub-bands and all the frequencies in these sub-bands.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetEntry.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetEntry
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetEntry.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. An entry in the Frequency Subset Table.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetBandId.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetBandIdx
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetBandId.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The index of the applicable Sub Band. This is the Sub Band ID of the relevant entry in the Country Dependent Parameters table. Serves also as an index of the entry in the Frequency subset Table.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetFreque.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetFrequencyIdx
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetFreque.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The index of the applicable frequency in the applicable Sub Band. Serves also as an index of the entry in the Frequency subset Table.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetActive.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetActive
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetActive.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The status of an entry in the Auto Sub Band Frequency subset Table. The frequency of an active entry will be included in the final list of frequencies to be used for scanning.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetFreque.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetFrequency
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetFreque.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The frequency in MHz of the entry in the Auto Sub Band Frequency Subset table.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetBandwi.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetBandwidth
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetBandwi.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The bandwidth in MHz of the entry in the Auto Sub Band Frequency Subset table.

brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetDFSSta.name: brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetDFSStatus
brzaccVLAutoSubBandFrequencySubsetDFSSta.description: Applicable to SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The channel status of the entry in the Auto Sub Band Frequency Subset table.

brzaccVLAtpcOption.name: brzaccVLAtpcOption
brzaccVLAtpcOption.description: Applicable all units. Enabling/disabling the ATPC Algorithm.

brzaccVLDeltaFromMinSNRLevel.name: brzaccVLDeltaFromMinSNRLevel
brzaccVLDeltaFromMinSNRLevel.description: Applicable AU/BU only. The Minimum SNR Level plus the value of this parameter define the maximum desired level of the average SNR at the AU/BU. If the ATPC Option is enabled, than if the received SNR is above the maximum desired level, the AU/BU will transmit Power-Down messages to the applicable SU/RB. Range: 4 to 20 (dB).

brzaccVLMinimumSNRLevel.name: brzaccVLMinimumSNRLevel
brzaccVLMinimumSNRLevel.description: Applicable AU/BU only. Defines the minimum desired level of the average SNR at the AU/BU. Below this level, if *AtpcOption is enabled, the AU/BU will transmit ATPC Power-Up messages to the applicable SU/RB. The *MinimumSNRLevel cannot be higher than *MaximumSNRLevel. Range: 4 to 60 (dB).

brzaccVLMinimumIntervalBetweenATPCMessag.name: brzaccVLMinimumIntervalBetweenATPCMessages
brzaccVLMinimumIntervalBetweenATPCMessag.description: Applicable AU/BU only. The minimum interval between two consecutive AU/BU to SU/RB messages. Range: 1 to 3600 (Sec).

brzaccVLPowerLevelSteps.name: brzaccVLPowerLevelSteps
brzaccVLPowerLevelSteps.description: Applicable AU/BU only. The step in dB that the SU/RB will use when receiving an ATPC Power-Up/Power-Down message. Range: 1 to 20 (dB).

brzaccVLAtpcOptionEZ.name: brzaccVLAtpcOptionEZ
brzaccVLAtpcOptionEZ.description: Applicable AU only. Enabling/disabling the ATPC Algorithm for EZ.

brzaccVLCellDistanceMode.name: brzaccVLCellDistanceMode
brzaccVLCellDistanceMode.description: Applicable AU/BU only. The selected mode of deciding on Cell Distance.

brzaccVLFairnessFactor.name: brzaccVLFairnessFactor
brzaccVLFairnessFactor.description: Applicable AU/BU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products for SW version below 4.0. The percentage of the maximum distance that is taken into account in the time slot calculation. Range: 0 to 100 (Percent). A value of 0 means the minimal slot size (9 microseconds). BreezeNET-B products with SW version below 4.0 return na. The na value is 255.

brzaccVLMeasuredCellDistance.name: brzaccVLMeasuredCellDistance
brzaccVLMeasuredCellDistance.description: Applicable AU/BU only. The Maximum Cell Distance as calculated by the AU/BU. Range: 0 to 54 (Kilometers).

brzaccVLUnitWithMaxDistance.name: brzaccVLUnitWithMaxDistance
brzaccVLUnitWithMaxDistance.description: Applicable AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B units. The MAC address of the unit with the maximum distance from the AU.

brzaccVLPerSuDistanceLearning.name: brzaccVLPerSuDistanceLearning
brzaccVLPerSuDistanceLearning.description: Aplicable to AU only. Applicable only if Cell Distance Mode is set to Automatic. When disabled, all SUs in the cell will use for the ACK Timeout the computed distance of the farthest SU. When enabled, each SU will use its own computed distance

brzaccVLScanningMode.name: brzaccVLScanningMode
brzaccVLScanningMode.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The scanning mode. In cells where the DFS Option is enabled Scanning Mode is forced to Passive.

brzaccVLAntennaGain.name: brzaccVLAntennaGain
brzaccVLAntennaGain.description: Applicable to all units. Read-write in units where brzaccVLAntennaGainChange is supported. Read-only in units where brzaccVLAntennaGainChange is not supported. The net gain (including cable attenuation for detached antennas) of the antenna. Range: 0 - to Maximum EIRP defined by country code + 10 (dBi). A value of -2 (this value is configurable only in factory) means don't care. A value of -1 (this value is configurable only in factory) means that the unit will not transmit until the actual value is configured.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisChannelScanPerio.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisChannelScanPeriod
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisChannelScanPerio.description: Applicable to all units. The period of staying on each channel for information gathering when performing Spectrum analysis. Range: 2-30 seconds.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisScanCycles.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisScanCycles
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisScanCycles.description: Applicable to all units. The number of scanning cycles when performing Spectrum Analysis. Range: 1-100.

brzaccVLAutomaticChannelSelection.name: brzaccVLAutomaticChannelSelection
brzaccVLAutomaticChannelSelection.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Defines weather the AU/BU shall choose the most noise free channel upon startup after spectrum analysis.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisActivation.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisActivation
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisActivation.description: Applicable to all units. Activates spectrum analysis, the unit is automatically reset upon activation.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisStatus.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisStatus
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisStatus.description: Applicable to all units. Defines whether the unit is currently performing a Spectrum Analysis process. Value currentlyBlocked means unit current status prohibits Spectrum Analysis activation.

brzaccVLResetSpectrumCounters.name: brzaccVLResetSpectrumCounters
brzaccVLResetSpectrumCounters.description: Applicable to all units. Resets the spectrum analysis counters.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationTable.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationTable
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationTable.description: Applicable to all units. The spectrum analysis information table.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationEntry.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationEntry
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationEntry.description: Applicable to all units. The spectrum analysis information table entry.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationTable.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationTableIdx
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationTable.description: Applicable to all units. A read only table index for a Spectrum Analysis Information entry in the Spectrum Analysis Information Table.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationChann.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationChannel
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationChann.description: Applicable to all units. The channels in the Spectrum Analysis Information Table. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the channels would be those on which the analysis is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the channels would be the those on which the last analysis was performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSignalCount
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.description: Applicable to all units. The number of signals (excluding OFDM frames) detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the count would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the count would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSignalSNR
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.description: Applicable to all units. The approximate SNR of the signals (excluding OFDM frames) detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the SNR would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the SNR would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSignalWidth
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.description: Applicable to all units. The average width of the signals (excluding OFDM frames) detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the width would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the width would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMF.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMFrames
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMF.description: Applicable to all units. The number of OFDM frames detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the count would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the count would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMA.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMAvgSnr
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMA.description: Applicable to all units. The average SNR of the OFDM frames detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the average SNR would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the average SNR would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationAvgNo.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationAvgNoiseFloor
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationAvgNo.description: Applicable to all units. The average Noise Floor detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the average Noise Floor would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the average Noise Floor would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationMaxNo.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationMaxNoiseFloor
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationMaxNo.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum Noise Floor detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the maximum Noise Floor would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the maximum Noise Floor would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSignalMaxSNR
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationSigna.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum SNR of the signals (excluding OFDM frames) detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the maximum SNR would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the maximum SNR would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMM.name: brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMMaxSNR
brzaccVLSpectrumAnalysisInformationOFDMM.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum SNR of the OFDM frames detected in the channel. If the unit is currently under spectrum analysis the maximum SNR would be of the analysis that is currently performed. If the unit is in normal mode the maximum SNR would be of the last analysis performed.

brzaccVLMaxNumOfAssociationsLimit.name: brzaccVLMaxNumOfAssociationsLimit
brzaccVLMaxNumOfAssociationsLimit.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. Shows the limit for the number of SUs that can be associated with the AU. For AU-BS, AU-SA, AU if Data Encryption is enabled, the upper limit is 124, otherwise it is 512. For AUS-BS, AUS-SA with SW version 4.0 and higher the upper limit is 8 or 25 (via licensing). For AUS-BS, AUS-SA with SW version below 4.0 the upper limit is 5. BreezeNET-B products return 65535.

brzaccVLDisassociateAllSUs.name: brzaccVLDisassociateAllSUs
brzaccVLDisassociateAllSUs.description: Applicable to AU only. The AU shall disassociate all its associated units.

brzaccVLDisassociateSuByMacAddress.name: brzaccVLDisassociateSuByMacAddress
brzaccVLDisassociateSuByMacAddress.description: Applicable to AU only. The AU shall disassociate the SU with the configured MAC address.

brzaccVLTxControl.name: brzaccVLTxControl
brzaccVLTxControl.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Tx Control of the AU/BU. Starting with version 4.0 it is run-time. For SW version below 4.0 the unit reset itself. If set to ethernetStatusControl, the unit will not transmit if the Ethernet link is down. This parameter can be configured only via the ethernet port.

brzaccVLLostBeaconsWatchdogThreshold.name: brzaccVLLostBeaconsWatchdogThreshold
brzaccVLLostBeaconsWatchdogThreshold.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The number of unsuccessful consecutive transmissions beacons before Internal refresh is performed. 0 means that the lost beacons watchdog is not used and internal refresh is not performed.

brzaccVLTransmitPower.name: brzaccVLTransmitPower
brzaccVLTransmitPower.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 4.0 and higher. The uniform transmit power for all modulation levels. For a specific modulation level the effective transmit power (brzaccVLTxPower) is the minimum between the uniform transmit power and the maximum transmit power for that modulation level.

brzaccVLMaximumTxPower.name: brzaccVLMaximumTxPower
brzaccVLMaximumTxPower.description: Applicable to only SU/RB with SW version 4.0 and higher. The Maximum Transmit Power for all modulation levels. The Maximum Transmit Power for a specific modulation level is the minimum between this parameter and the hardware limitation for that modulation level

brzaccVLCountryCodeReApply.name: brzaccVLCountryCodeReApply
brzaccVLCountryCodeReApply.description: Applicable to all units. Re-apply country code parameters.

brzaccVLCCParamsTable.name: brzaccVLCCParamsTable
brzaccVLCCParamsTable.description: Applicable to all units. A table of country dependent parameters.

brzaccVLCCParamsFrequencies.name: brzaccVLCCParamsFrequencies
brzaccVLCCParamsFrequencies.description: Applicable to all units. The frequencies included in the applicable sub-band entry.

brzaccVLCCAllowedBandwidth.name: brzaccVLCCAllowedBandwidth
brzaccVLCCAllowedBandwidth.description: Applicable to all units. The bandwidth when using the applicable the sub-band.

brzaccVLCCRegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaP.name: brzaccVLCCRegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaPort
brzaccVLCCRegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaP.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum allowed Tx power when using the applicable sub-band. A RegulationMaxTxPowerAtAntennaPort of 255, means no limit

brzaccVLCCRegulationMaxEIRP.name: brzaccVLCCRegulationMaxEIRP
brzaccVLCCRegulationMaxEIRP.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum Tx EIRP when using the applicable sub-band. A Regulation Max EIRP of 0, means no limit.

brzaccVLCCMinModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLCCMinModulationLevel
brzaccVLCCMinModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units. The minimum supported modulation level.

brzaccVLCCMaxModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLCCMaxModulationLevel
brzaccVLCCMaxModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum supported modulation level.

brzaccVLCCBurstModeSupport.name: brzaccVLCCBurstModeSupport
brzaccVLCCBurstModeSupport.description: Applicable to all units. The supported Burst Mode Option.

brzaccVLCCMaximumBurstDuration.name: brzaccVLCCMaximumBurstDuration
brzaccVLCCMaximumBurstDuration.description: Applicable to all units. Applicable only if Burst Mode Option is supported. The maximum supported burst duration.

brzaccVLCCDfsSupport.name: brzaccVLCCDfsSupport
brzaccVLCCDfsSupport.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The supported Dfs Option.

brzaccVLCCMinimumHwRevision.name: brzaccVLCCMinimumHwRevision
brzaccVLCCMinimumHwRevision.description: Applicable to all units. The Minimum HW Revision needed to support the country code.

brzaccVLCountryCodeSelect.name: brzaccVLCountryCodeSelect
brzaccVLCountryCodeSelect.description: Applicable to all units. Configure the Country Code WARNING: It is the responsibility of the wireless system operator to verify that use of the selected Country Code does not result in violation of the relevant local radio regulations! For more details refer to the Selecting Country Code document

brzaccVLNoiseImmunityAlgorithm.name: brzaccVLNoiseImmunityAlgorithm
brzaccVLNoiseImmunityAlgorithm.description: Applicable to all units except for units with HW revision B and lower. automatic(2) is not applicable for units with HW revision F or G. Noise Immunity Algorithm

brzaccVLNoiseImmunityLevel.name: brzaccVLNoiseImmunityLevel
brzaccVLNoiseImmunityLevel.description: Applicable to all units except for units with HW revision B and lower. Noise Immunity Level. (255) : Not Available

brzaccVLSpuriousImmunityLevel.name: brzaccVLSpuriousImmunityLevel
brzaccVLSpuriousImmunityLevel.description: Applicable to all units except for units with HW revision B and lower. (255) : Not Available

brzaccVLOFDMWeakSignal.name: brzaccVLOFDMWeakSignal
brzaccVLOFDMWeakSignal.description: Applicable to all units except for units with HW revision B and lower.

brzaccVLNoiseFloorForcedValue.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorForcedValue
brzaccVLNoiseFloorForcedValue.description: Applicable to all units. Range: -107 to -55

brzaccVLNoiseFloorRunCalibration.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorRunCalibration
brzaccVLNoiseFloorRunCalibration.description: Not applicable to 900 MHz units. Start calibration process for Noise Floor Indication. The unit will rest itself, will perform calibration and after that will reset again. The status of last calibration run can be read from brzaccVLNoiseFloorIndicationLastCalibrationResult. Get operation will return cancel(2); on 900 MHz units it will return na(255).

brzaccVLNoiseFloorFieldCalibrationStatus.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorFieldCalibrationStatus
brzaccVLNoiseFloorFieldCalibrationStatus.description: Applicable to all units. Defines weather the unit is currently under performing a noise floor indication calibration.

brzaccVLNoiseFloorLastFieldCalibrationRe.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorLastFieldCalibrationResult
brzaccVLNoiseFloorLastFieldCalibrationRe.description: Applicable to all units. Return the status of last calibration of Noise Floor Indication that was performed.

brzaccVLNoiseFloorBandwidthUsedForLastFi.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorBandwidthUsedForLastFieldCalibration
brzaccVLNoiseFloorBandwidthUsedForLastFi.description: Applicable to all units. Return the bandwidth used for last successful calibration of Noise Floor Indication.

brzaccVLNoiseFloorAvailableCalibrationOp.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorAvailableCalibrationOptions
brzaccVLNoiseFloorAvailableCalibrationOp.description: Applicable to all units. Indicates what types of Noise Floor Indication calibration are available: notCalibrated: means that the unit is not calibrated factoryOnly: means that the unit was calibrated in factory fieldOnly: means that the unit was calibrated in field using brzaccVLNoiseFloorIndicationRunCalibration command factoryAndField: means that unit was calibrated in factory and also in field

brzaccVLNoiseFloorUseCalibration.name: brzaccVLNoiseFloorUseCalibration
brzaccVLNoiseFloorUseCalibration.description: Not applicable to 900 MHz units. Select if the Noise Floor reported by the unit is using the calibration of Noise Floor Indication. The value that can be choose are according with brzaccVLNoiseFloorIndicationCalibrationAvailability.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationChannelSca.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationChannelScanPeriod
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationChannelSca.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The period of time, in seconds, to stay on each channel to gather information, when performing Interference Mitigation or Spectrum Analysis. Range: 2-30 seconds.

brzaccVLBeaconPeriod.name: brzaccVLBeaconPeriod
brzaccVLBeaconPeriod.description: Applicable only to AU VL. Range: 16-160 miliseconds.

brzaccVLMaxBeaconsLost.name: brzaccVLMaxBeaconsLost
brzaccVLMaxBeaconsLost.description: Applicable only to AU VL. Range: 3-64.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAutomaticS.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAutomaticScanPeriod
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAutomaticS.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The period of time, in minutes, to execute automatic channel scanning, when performing Interference Mitigation. Range: 0 or 10-10080 minutes. A value of 0 means periodicity disabled, Interference Mitigation being performed only one time.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanType.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanType
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanType.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The selected method for scanning, when performing Interference Mitigation.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanMode.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanMode
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanMode.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The selected Optimization Criteria to choose the best result, when performing Interference Mitigation: 1 = best throughput, 2 = best distance.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationDistance.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationDistance
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationDistance.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The desired value of Maximum Distance, utilized if Optimization Criteria is set to best distance, when performing Interference Mitigation. Range: 100 - 54000 meters.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationThroughput.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationThroughput
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationThroughput.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The desired value of Throughput, utilized if Optimization Criteria is set to best throughput, when performing Interference Mitigation. Range: 500-10000 Kbps.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationActivation.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationActivation
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationActivation.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Activates Interference Mitigation, the unit is automatically reset upon activation.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationStatus.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationStatus
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationStatus.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Defines whether the unit is currently performing an Interference Mitigation process. Value currentlyBlocked means unit current status prohibits Interference Mitigation activation.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationDeleteStat.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationDeleteStatisticsFile
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationDeleteStat.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Deletes the Interference Mitigation statistics file.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationModel.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationModel
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationModel.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Specifies the Installation Model used by the cell.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanTime.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanTime
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationScanTime.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Displays the estimated value of the scan time.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAUheight.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAUheight
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAUheight.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The Base Station height used in determining the best noise floor in the Interference Mitigation algorithm. Range: 0 - 300 meters.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAntennaGai.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAntennaGain
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationAntennaGai.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The Antenna Gain of the pair unit (AU/SU), expressed in dBi. Range: 10 - 17 dBi.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationMaxModulat.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationMaxModulation
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationMaxModulat.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The maximum modulation of the pair untit. Range: 1 - 8.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationKeepLink.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationKeepLink
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationKeepLink.description: Applicable to 900 MHz AU units, 2.4 GHz AU units and BNB10. Activates the KeepLink procedure in order to not lose SUs near the border of the cell

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputTabl.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputTable
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputTabl.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. A table of Clear Channel Selection or Automatic Noise Floor Selection results.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputEntr.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputEntry
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputEntr.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. An entry in the InterferenceMitigationOutputTable.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputFreq.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputFrequency
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputFreq.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. The channel frequency

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputScan.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputScanningType
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputScan.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Type of scan that was run

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputInst.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputInstallationModel
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputInst.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Specifies the Installation Model used by the cell.

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputNois.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputNoiseFloor
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputNois.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Noise floor calculated for current frequency

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputDist.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputDistance
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputDist.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Estimated cell radius

brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputPerf.name: brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputPerformance
brzaccVLInterferenceMitigationOutputPerf.description: Applicable to 900 MHz units, 2.4 GHz units and BNB10. Estimated cell performance

brzaccVLMirDownlink.name: brzaccVLMirDownlink
brzaccVLMirDownlink.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The Maximum Information Rate (MIR) from AU/BU to SU/RB. MIR must be above brzaccVLCirDownlink value. Range for set: 128 to 2,048 (Kbps) for SU-3 with SW version below 4.0, 128 to 3,072 (Kbps) for SU-3 with SW version 4.0 and higher, 128 to 3,968 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version less than 4.0, 128 to 6,016 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version greater than 4.0, 128 to 14,976 (Kbps) for SU-24, 128 to 53,888 (Kbps) for SU-BD and SU-54, 128 to 13,440 (Kbps) for SU-8, 128 to 6,912 (Kbps) for RB-14, 128 to 22,016 (Kbps) for RB-28, 128 to 107,904 (Kbps) for RB-100, 128 to 6,016 (Kbps) for SU-I, 128 to 12,032 (Kbps) for SU-V, 128 to 4,992 (Kbps) for RB-10, 128 to 1,024 (Kbps) for SU-1-BD The actual value (Get) will be the entered value rounded to the nearest multiple of 128 (N*128).

brzaccVLMirUplink.name: brzaccVLMirUplink
brzaccVLMirUplink.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The Maximum Information Rate (MIR) from SU/RB to AU/BU. MIR must be above brzaccVLCirUplink value. Range for set: 128 to 2,048 (Kbps) for SU-3, 128 to 3,968 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version less than 4.0, 128 to 4,096 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version greater than 4.0, 128 to 14,976 (Kbps) for SU-24, 128 to 53,888 (Kbps) for SU-BD and SU-54, 128 to 13,440 (Kbps) for SU-8, 128 to 6,912 (Kbps) for RB-14, 128 to 22,016 (Kbps) for RB-28, 128 to 107,904 (Kbps) for RB-100, 128 to 4,096 (Kbps) for SU-I, 128 to 8,064 (Kbps) for SU-V, 128 to 4,992 (Kbps) for RB-10, 128 to 896 (Kbps) for SU-1-BD The actual value (Get) will be the entered value rounded to the nearest multiple of 128 (N*128).

brzaccVLCirDownlink.name: brzaccVLCirDownlink
brzaccVLCirDownlink.description: Applicable to SU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The Committed Information Rate (CIR) from AU to SU. CIR must be below brzaccVLMirDownlink value. Range for Set: 0 to 2,048 (Kbps) for SU-3 with SW version below 4.0, 0 to 3,072 (Kbps) for SU-3 with SW version 4.0 and higher, 0 to 3,968 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version less than 4.0, 0 to 6,016 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version greater than 4.0, 0 to 14,976 (Kbps) for SU-24, 0 to 45,056 (Kbps) for SU-BD and SU-54, 0 to 11,264 (Kbps) for SU-8, 0 to 6,016 (Kbps) for SU-I, 0 to 12,032 (Kbps) for SU-V, 0 to 4,992 (Kbps) for RB-10, 0 to 1,024 (Kbps) for SU-1-BD The actual value (Get) will be the entered value rounded to the nearest multiple of 128 (N*128). BreezeNET-B products will return 65535.

brzaccVLCirUplink.name: brzaccVLCirUplink
brzaccVLCirUplink.description: Applicable to SU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The Committed Information Rate (CIR) from SU to AU. CIR must be below brzaccVLMirUplink value. Range for Set: 0 to 2,048 (Kbps) for SU-3, 0 to 3,968 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version less than 4.0, 0 to 4,096 (Kbps) for SU-6 with SW version greater than 4.0, 0 to 14,976 (Kbps) for SU-24, 0 to 45,056 (Kbps) for SU-BD and SU-54, 0 to 11,264 (Kbps) for SU-8, 0 to 2,048 (Kbps) for SU-I, 0 to 8,064 (Kbps) for SU-V, 0 to 4,992 (Kbps) for RB-10, 0 to 896 (Kbps) for SU-1-BD The actual value (Get) will be the entered value rounded to the nearest multiple of 128 (N*128). BreezeNET-B products will return 65535.

brzaccVLMaxDelay.name: brzaccVLMaxDelay
brzaccVLMaxDelay.description: Applicable to SU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The maximal time packets may be delayed by the CIR\MIR mechanism. Above the configured maximal period the packets are discarded. Range: 300 to 10000 milliseconds. BreezeNET-B products return 65535.

brzaccVLMaxBurstDuration.name: brzaccVLMaxBurstDuration
brzaccVLMaxBurstDuration.description: Applicable to all units. The maximum time during which inactivity bonus time can be accumulated for future burst transmissions. Range: 0 to 2000 milliseconds.

brzaccVLGracefulDegradationLimit.name: brzaccVLGracefulDegradationLimit
brzaccVLGracefulDegradationLimit.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The maximum limit for activating the graceful degradation algorithm. Range: 0 to 70% rate of the CIR. BreezeNET-B products return 255.

brzaccVLMirOnlyOption.name: brzaccVLMirOnlyOption
brzaccVLMirOnlyOption.description: Applicable to AU only. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. When brzaccMirOnly is enabled, it overrides the CIR/MIR algorithm for determining actual information rate and forces the algorithm to operate with MIR parameter settings only. When enabled, the Graceful Degradation algorithm is disabled.

brzaccVLVLANPriorityThreshold.name: brzaccVLVLANPriorityThreshold
brzaccVLVLANPriorityThreshold.description: Applicable to all units. If the VLAN Priority's value of the frame is less than or equal to this threshold the frame will get LOW priority, otherwise the frame will get HIGH priority. Untagged frames will get LOW priority

brzaccVLToSPrioritizationOption.name: brzaccVLToSPrioritizationOption
brzaccVLToSPrioritizationOption.description: Applicable to all units. Disable/Enable IP ToS prioritization and choose the interpretation of the IP ToS field from IP header. ipPrecedence(2): The IP ToS field is defined by RFC791. In this case the prioritization will be done using the Precedence sub-field of IP ToS. This sub-field has 3 bits, so it can be between 0 and 7. dSCP(3): The IP ToS field is defined by RFC2474. In this case the prioritization will be done using the DSCP sub-field. The size of the sub-field is 6 bits, so the range is 0 to 63.

brzaccVLIPPrecedenceThreshold.name: brzaccVLIPPrecedenceThreshold
brzaccVLIPPrecedenceThreshold.description: Applicable to all units. The threshold of Precedence sub-field of IP ToS field from IP Header (RFC791) to be used when the ToS Prioritization Option is set to IP Precedence. If the Precedence sub-field of a frame is less than or equal to this threshold the frame will have LOW priority, otherwise it will get HIGH priority.

brzaccVLIPDSCPThreshold.name: brzaccVLIPDSCPThreshold
brzaccVLIPDSCPThreshold.description: Applicable to all units. The threshold of DSCP sub-field of IP ToS field from IP Header (RFC2474) to be used when ToS Prioritization Option is set to DSCP. If the DSCP sub-field of a frame is less than or equal to this threshold the frame will have LOW priority, otherwise it will get HIGH priority.

brzaccVLUdpTcpPortRangePrioritizationOpt.name: brzaccVLUdpTcpPortRangePrioritizationOption
brzaccVLUdpTcpPortRangePrioritizationOpt.description: Applicable to all units. Disable/Enable Prioritization using UDP and/or TCP Port Ranges. udpOnly(2) : prioritization will be done only for UDP packets tcpOnly(3) : prioritization will be done only for TCP packets udpANDtcp(4): prioritization will be done for UDP and TCP packets

brzaccVLUdpPortPriRTPRTCP.name: brzaccVLUdpPortPriRTPRTCP
brzaccVLUdpPortPriRTPRTCP.description: Applicale to all units. RTP/RTCP ports prioritization option for UDP packets. rtpANDrtcp(1): RTP and RTCP packets with destination port in the defined port ranges will get HIGH priority rtpOnly(2): only RTP packets (packets with even destination port) with destination port in the defined port ranges will get HIGH priority.

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeNum.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeNum
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeNum.description: Applicable to all units. The number of entries in the UDP Port Range Table

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeTable.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeTable
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeTable.description: Applicable to all units. A table of UDP port ranges use for prioritization. The user can define up to 64 ranges. An entry is empty if start is 65535 and end is 0

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeEntry.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeEntry
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A UDP Port Ranges Table entry.

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeStart.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeStart
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeStart.description: Applicable to all units. Start port of an UDP Port Range

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeEnd.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeEnd
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeEnd.description: Applicable to all units. End port of an UDP Port Range

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeIdx.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeIdx
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeIdx.description: Applicable to all units. UDP Port Range Entry's index

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeAdd.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeAdd
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeAdd.description: Applicable to all units. Add port range(s) to UDP Port Ranges Table. Get operation will return the empty string. A range is defined <start>-<end> or <start> where <start> is the Start Port of the range and <end> is the End Port. If only <start> is specified the range is <start>-<start>. The value of <start> and <end> are between 0..65535. The user can add several ranges using a comma to separate between ranges. Example: 10-256,99,987-900

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeDelete.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeDelete
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeDelete.description: Applicable to all units. Delete port range(s) from UDP Port Ranges Table. Get operation will return the empty string. A range is defined <start>-<end> or <start> where <start> is the Start Port of the range and <end> is the End Port. If only <start> is specified the range is <start>-<start>. The value of <start> and <end> are between 0..65535. The user can delete several ranges using a comma to separate between ranges. Example: 10-256,99,987-900

brzaccVLUdpPortRangeDeleteAll.name: brzaccVLUdpPortRangeDeleteAll
brzaccVLUdpPortRangeDeleteAll.description: Applicable to all units. Delete all entries form UDP Port Ranges Table. Get operation will return 1

brzaccVLTcpPortPriRTPRTCP.name: brzaccVLTcpPortPriRTPRTCP
brzaccVLTcpPortPriRTPRTCP.description: Applicable to all units. RTP/RTCP ports prioritization option for TCP packets. rtpANDrtcp(1): RTP and RTCP packets with destination port in the defined port ranges will get HIGH priority rtpOnly(2): only RTP packets (packets with even destination port) with destination port in the defined port ranges will get HIGH priority.

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeNum.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeNum
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeNum.description: Applicable to all units. The number of entries in the TCP Port Range Table

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeTable.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeTable
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeTable.description: Table of TCP Port Ranges use for prioritization. The user can define up to 64 ranges. An entry is empty if start is 65535 and end is 0

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeEntry.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeEntry
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeEntry.description: Applicable to all units. A TCP Port Ranges Table entry.

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeStart.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeStart
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeStart.description: Applicable to all units. Start port of a TCP Port Range

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeEnd.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeEnd
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeEnd.description: Applicable to all units. End port of a TCP Port Range

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeIdx.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeIdx
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeIdx.description: Applicable to all units. TCP Port Range Entry's index

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeAdd.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeAdd
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeAdd.description: Applicable to all units. Add port range(s) to TCP Port Ranges Table. Get operation will return the empty string. A range is defined <start>-<end> or <start> where <start> is the Start Port of the range and <end> is the End Port. If only <start> is specified the range is <start>-<start>. The value of <start> and <end> are between 0..65535. The user can add several ranges using comma to separate between ranges. Example: 10-256,99,987-900

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeDelete.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeDelete
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeDelete.description: Applicable to all units. Delete port range(s) from TCP Port Ranges Table. Get operation will return the empty string. A range is defined <start>-<end> or <start> where <start> is the Start Port of the range and <end> is the End Port. If only <start> is specified the range is <start>-<start>. The value of <start> and <end> are between 0..65535. The user can delete several ranges using comma to separate between ranges. Example: 10-256,99,987-900

brzaccVLTcpPortRangeDeleteAll.name: brzaccVLTcpPortRangeDeleteAll
brzaccVLTcpPortRangeDeleteAll.description: Applicable to all units. Delete all entries form TCP Port Ranges Table Get operation will return 1

brzaccVLWirelessLinkPrioritizationOption.name: brzaccVLWirelessLinkPrioritizationOption
brzaccVLWirelessLinkPrioritizationOption.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Enable/disable the traffic prioritization over the Wireless Link

brzaccVLlowPriorityAIFS.name: brzaccVLlowPriorityAIFS
brzaccVLlowPriorityAIFS.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Define the AIFS (Arbitration Inter-frame Space) that will be used for transmitting Low Priority Traffic

brzaccVLHWRetriesHighPriority.name: brzaccVLHWRetriesHighPriority
brzaccVLHWRetriesHighPriority.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Defines the Maximum number of HW Retries for a unicast data packet that has High Priority

brzaccVLHWRetriesLowPriority.name: brzaccVLHWRetriesLowPriority
brzaccVLHWRetriesLowPriority.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Defines the Maximum number of HW Retries for a unicast data packet that has Low Priority

brzaccVLAUBurstDurationHighPriority.name: brzaccVLAUBurstDurationHighPriority
brzaccVLAUBurstDurationHighPriority.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Defines the Maximum duration of burst that can be done by AU with High Priority packets. The time is given in 250 microseconds units

brzaccVLAUBurstDurationLowPriority.name: brzaccVLAUBurstDurationLowPriority
brzaccVLAUBurstDurationLowPriority.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Defines the Maximum duration of burst that can be done by AU with Low Priority packets. The time is given in 250 microseconds units

brzaccVLSUBurstDurationHighPriority.name: brzaccVLSUBurstDurationHighPriority
brzaccVLSUBurstDurationHighPriority.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Defines the Maximum duration of burst that can be done by SU/RB with High Priority packets. The parameter is configurable in AU and the SUs/RB will learn it form AU/BU. The time is given in 250 microseconds units

brzaccVLSUBurstDurationLowPriority.name: brzaccVLSUBurstDurationLowPriority
brzaccVLSUBurstDurationLowPriority.description: Applicable only to AU with a license for the Wireless Link Prioritization feature and to BU-100. Applicable only if the Wireless Link Prioritization Option is enabled. Defines the Maximum duration of burst that can be done by SU/RB with High Priority packets. The parameter is configurable in AU/BU and the SUs/RB will learn it from AU/BU. The time is given in 250 microseconds units

brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeOption.name: brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeOption
brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeOption.description: Applicable to all units. disable(1): Disable IP Range Prioritization. ipSource(2): Prioritization of the IP protocol packets with IP source address in range defined by following two OIDs. ipDestination(3): Prioritization of the IP protocol packets with IP destination address in range defined by following two OIDs. ipSourceOrDestination(4): Prioritization of the IP protocol packets with IP source address or IP destination address in range defined by following two OIDs.

brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeIpAddress.name: brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeIpAddress
brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeIpAddress.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the IP Address for the IP Range Prioritization. IP protocol packets with IP source address in range defined by Address and Mask will get High Priority.

brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeIpMask.name: brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeIpMask
brzaccVLTrafficPriIpRangeIpMask.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the IP Mask for the IP Range Prioritization. IP protocol packets with IP source address in range defined by Address and Mask will get High Priority.

brzaccVLDrapSupport.name: brzaccVLDrapSupport
brzaccVLDrapSupport.description: Applicable to AU. Not applicable to BreezeNET B products Disable/Enable the DRAP feature

brzaccVLDrapUdpPort.name: brzaccVLDrapUdpPort
brzaccVLDrapUdpPort.description: Applicable to AU when DRAP support is enabled. Not applicable to BreezeNET B products. The UDP port used for the DRAP server

brzaccVLDrapMaxNumberOfVoiceCalls.name: brzaccVLDrapMaxNumberOfVoiceCalls
brzaccVLDrapMaxNumberOfVoiceCalls.description: Applicable to AU when DRAP support is enabled. Not applicable to BreezeNET B products. The maximum number of voice calls that can be supported by the AU

brzaccVLDrapTTL.name: brzaccVLDrapTTL
brzaccVLDrapTTL.description: Applicable to AU when DRAP support is enabled. Not applicable to BreezeNET B products. The maximum time between two allocation requests

brzaccVLDrapNoOfActiveVoiceCalls.name: brzaccVLDrapNoOfActiveVoiceCalls
brzaccVLDrapNoOfActiveVoiceCalls.description: Applicable to AU when DRAP support is enabled. Not applicable to BreezeNET B products. The current total number of active voice calls.

brzaccVLLowPriorityTrafficMinimumPercent.name: brzaccVLLowPriorityTrafficMinimumPercent
brzaccVLLowPriorityTrafficMinimumPercent.description: The minimum percent of the traffic rate that is allocated to the low priority traffic

brzaccVLSUEZMirDownlink.name: brzaccVLSUEZMirDownlink
brzaccVLSUEZMirDownlink.description: Applicable to AU only. The Maximum Information Rate (MIR) from AU to SU-EZ. Range for set: 128 to 12,032 (Kbps). The actual value (Get) will be the entered value rounded to the nearest multiple of 128 (N*128). This parameter is not runtime. The SU-EZ must be re-associated in order to re-apply this parameter.

brzaccVLMIRThresholdPercent.name: brzaccVLMIRThresholdPercent
brzaccVLMIRThresholdPercent.description: Applicable to AU only. MIR Threshold Percent

brzaccVLProportionalIRFactor.name: brzaccVLProportionalIRFactor
brzaccVLProportionalIRFactor.description: Applicable to SU only. Proportional IR Factor (percentage). The weight used for computing the used MIR/CIR values.

brzaccVLProportionalIRUpdatePeriod.name: brzaccVLProportionalIRUpdatePeriod
brzaccVLProportionalIRUpdatePeriod.description: Applicable to SU only. The period of time (in minutes) for periodical computation of used MIR/CIR values.

brzaccVLProportionalIRThresholdPercentag.name: brzaccVLProportionalIRThresholdPercentage
brzaccVLProportionalIRThresholdPercentag.description: Applicable to SU only. When the difference between two consecutive calculations of used MIR/CIR value is bigger than this percentage from value, the new computed MIR/CIR values will be considered.

brzaccVLProportionalIRThresholdRate.name: brzaccVLProportionalIRThresholdRate
brzaccVLProportionalIRThresholdRate.description: Applicable to SU only. The new computed MIR/CIR values will be considered only when the rate, on uplink or downlink respectively, is lower than the rate corresponding to this threshold rate.

brzaccVLUserFilterOption.name: brzaccVLUserFilterOption
brzaccVLUserFilterOption.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. Defines user-filtering options. disable: No filtering. iPOnly: Only IP protocol frames pass. userDefinedAddrOnly: Only ip frames to/from user defined IP addresses pass. pPPoE Only: Only PPPoE frames pass. This option is not applicable for AU

brzaccVLIpFilterTable.name: brzaccVLIpFilterTable
brzaccVLIpFilterTable.description: Starting with version 5.0, this is deprecated. Use brzaccVLNewIpFilterTable instead. Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP Filter Table of up to 8 user defined addresses, or address groups, to be used if the selected User Filtering option is userDefinedAddrOnly.

brzaccVLIpFilterEntry.name: brzaccVLIpFilterEntry
brzaccVLIpFilterEntry.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLIpID.name: brzaccVLIpID
brzaccVLIpID.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP address of an IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLMaskID.name: brzaccVLMaskID
brzaccVLMaskID.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP Mask of an IP Filter Table entry. Either a mask or a range, but not both can be used to define an address group. If the range is other than 0, than the mask is ignored and only the range value is used to define the address group.

brzaccVLIpFilterRange.name: brzaccVLIpFilterRange
brzaccVLIpFilterRange.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An addresses range for the IP Filter Table entry. The first address in the range is the IP address. 0 means that the range is not used. Either a mask or a range, but not both can be used to define an address group. If the range is other than 0, than the mask is ignored and only the range value is used to define the address group. Range: 0 to 255.

brzaccVLIpFilterIdx.name: brzaccVLIpFilterIdx
brzaccVLIpFilterIdx.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. A table index for the IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLDeleteOneUserFilter.name: brzaccVLDeleteOneUserFilter
brzaccVLDeleteOneUserFilter.description: Applicable to SU/RB and AU-EZ only. Deletes a single selected entry from the IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLDeleteAllUserFilters.name: brzaccVLDeleteAllUserFilters
brzaccVLDeleteAllUserFilters.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. Deletes all entries from the IP Filter Table.

brzaccVLDHCPUnicastOverrideFilter.name: brzaccVLDHCPUnicastOverrideFilter
brzaccVLDHCPUnicastOverrideFilter.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. Enables or disables the unicast DHCP messages, overriding the IP Filtering option.

brzaccVLNewIpFilterTable.name: brzaccVLNewIpFilterTable
brzaccVLNewIpFilterTable.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP Filter Table of up to 8 user defined addresses, or address groups, to be used if the selected User Filtering option is userDefinedAddrOnly.

brzaccVLNewIpFilterEntry.name: brzaccVLNewIpFilterEntry
brzaccVLNewIpFilterEntry.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLNewIpID.name: brzaccVLNewIpID
brzaccVLNewIpID.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP address of an IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLNewMaskID.name: brzaccVLNewMaskID
brzaccVLNewMaskID.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An IP Mask of an IP Filter Table entry. Either a mask or a range, but not both can be used to define an address group. If the range is other than 0, than the mask is ignored and only the range value is used to define the address group.

brzaccVLNewIpFilterRange.name: brzaccVLNewIpFilterRange
brzaccVLNewIpFilterRange.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. An addresses range for the IP Filter Table entry. The first address in the range is the IP address. 0 means that the range is not used. Either a mask or a range, but not both can be used to define an address group. If the range is other than 0, than the mask is ignored and only the range value is used to define the address group. Range: 0 to 255.

brzaccVLNewIpFilterCommand.name: brzaccVLNewIpFilterCommand
brzaccVLNewIpFilterCommand.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. Supports only active(1), createAndGo(4) and destroy(6). A command for the IP Filter Table entry.

brzaccVLDHCPPPPoEOverrideFilter.name: brzaccVLDHCPPPPoEOverrideFilter
brzaccVLDHCPPPPoEOverrideFilter.description: Applicable to SU, RB and AU. Not applicable to AU on 900 MHz. Enables or disables the PPPoE messages, overriding the IP Filtering option.

brzaccVLAuthenticationAlgorithm.name: brzaccVLAuthenticationAlgorithm
brzaccVLAuthenticationAlgorithm.description: Applicable to all units. Enables/disables the authentication encryption option. openSystem: Authentication messages are not encrypted. sharedKey : Authentication messages are encrypted

brzaccVLSUDefaultKeyID.name: brzaccVLSUDefaultKeyID
brzaccVLSUDefaultKeyID.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The key to be used for encryption of authentication messages and/or data. Range: 1 to 4.

brzaccVLDataEncryptionOption.name: brzaccVLDataEncryptionOption
brzaccVLDataEncryptionOption.description: Applicable to all units. Enables/disables the data encryption option.

brzaccVLAUDefaultMulticastKeyID.name: brzaccVLAUDefaultMulticastKeyID
brzaccVLAUDefaultMulticastKeyID.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The key to be used for encryption of multicasts and broadcasts.

brzaccVLSecurityMode.name: brzaccVLSecurityMode
brzaccVLSecurityMode.description: Applicable to all units. The fips197 option is applicable only to units with a license to use FIPS 197 algorithm. The encryption algorithm to be used for authentication messages and/or data encryption. The aesOCB option is not applicable for AU-EZ.

brzaccVLAuthenticationPromiscuousMode.name: brzaccVLAuthenticationPromiscuousMode
brzaccVLAuthenticationPromiscuousMode.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Enables/disable the promiscuous mode allowing authentication of and communication with all SUs/RB regardless of their security parameters.

brzaccVLKey1.name: brzaccVLKey1
brzaccVLKey1.description: Applicable to all units. Key number 1. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community String (administrator password). Valid values: 32 hexadecimal digits.

brzaccVLKey2.name: brzaccVLKey2
brzaccVLKey2.description: Applicable to all units. Key number 2. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community String (administrator password). Valid values: 32 hexadecimal digits.

brzaccVLKey3.name: brzaccVLKey3
brzaccVLKey3.description: Applicable to all units. Key number 3. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community String (administrator password). Valid values: 32 hexadecimal digits.

brzaccVLKey4.name: brzaccVLKey4
brzaccVLKey4.description: Applicable to all units. Key number 4. Accessible only with SNMP Write Community String (administrator password). Valid values: 32 hexadecimal digits.

brzaccVLSecurityModeSupport.name: brzaccVLSecurityModeSupport
brzaccVLSecurityModeSupport.description: Applicable to all units. Returns types of encryption that are supported. 0 - no encryption 1 - WEP 2 - AES OCB 3 - WEP and AES OCB 4 - FIPS-197 5 - FIPS-197 and WEP 6 - FIPS-197 and AES OCB 7 - FIPS-197, AES OCB and WEP

brzaccVLRTSThreshold.name: brzaccVLRTSThreshold
brzaccVLRTSThreshold.description: Applicable to SU and AU. Not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The minimum frame size that requires an RTS/CTS handshake. Range: For units bearing SW version 3.0 and above: 20 to 3400 bytes, for previous SW versions 20 to 1600 bytes. BreezeNET-B products return 65535.

brzaccVLMinContentionWindow.name: brzaccVLMinContentionWindow
brzaccVLMinContentionWindow.description: Applicable to SU and AU. For units bearing SW version 4.0 and above applicable to BreezeNET-B products, for previous SW versions not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The initial value to be used by the contention window calculation algorithm. Value must be 0 or power of 2 minus 1 (7,15,31...). Range: 0 to 1023, excluding 1 and 3. BreezeNET-B products with SW version below 4.0 return 65535.

brzaccVLMaxContentionWindow.name: brzaccVLMaxContentionWindow
brzaccVLMaxContentionWindow.description: Applicable to SU and AU. For units bearing SW version 4.0 and above applicable to BreezeNET-B products, for previous SW versions not applicable to BreezeNET-B products. The maximum value to be used by the contention window calculation algorithm. Value must be power of 2 minus 1 (7,15,31...) Range: 7 to 1023.

brzaccVLMaximumModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLMaximumModulationLevel
brzaccVLMaximumModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units. If the Adaptive Modulation algorithm is enabled, it sets the Maximum Modulation Level to be used. If The Modulation algorithm is disabled, it sets the Fixed Modulation Level to be used. The range is 1 to 8. 8 is not applicable for units with HW revision A.

brzaccVLMulticastModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLMulticastModulationLevel
brzaccVLMulticastModulationLevel.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The modulation level for multicast and broadcast data frames. The range is 1 to 8. 8 is not applicable for units with HW revision A.

brzaccVLAvgSNRMemoryFactor.name: brzaccVLAvgSNRMemoryFactor
brzaccVLAvgSNRMemoryFactor.description: Applicable to all units. The weight of history in average SNR calculation. The higher is the value, the higher is the weight of history. Range: -1 (Disregard History) to 32.

brzaccVLHardwareRetries.name: brzaccVLHardwareRetries
brzaccVLHardwareRetries.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable if Wireless Link Prioritization is enabled. The maximum number of trials to transmit an unacknowledged frame in each Hardware Retrial phase. Range : 1 to 14.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationAlgorithmOptio.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationAlgorithmOption
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationAlgorithmOptio.description: Applicable to all units. Enables/disables the adaptive modulation level decision mechanism.

brzaccVLSoftwareRetrySupport.name: brzaccVLSoftwareRetrySupport
brzaccVLSoftwareRetrySupport.description: Applicable to all units. Read-only for units with version 2.0. Not applicable for units with SW version 3.0 and higher. The status of the Software Retry mechanism. Enabled when the Adaptive Modulation algorithm is enabled and the Burst Mode Option is disabled. Otherwise it is disabled.

brzaccVLNumOfSoftwareRetries.name: brzaccVLNumOfSoftwareRetries
brzaccVLNumOfSoftwareRetries.description: Applicable to all units. Read-only for units with version 2.0. Not applicable for units with SW version 3.0 and higher. The maximum number of times to use the Software Retry mechanism when it is enabled.

brzaccVLMinIntervalBetweenAdaptiveModula.name: brzaccVLMinIntervalBetweenAdaptiveModulationAlgorithmMessages
brzaccVLMinIntervalBetweenAdaptiveModula.description: Applicable all units. The minimum interval between two consecutive AU/BU to SU/RB messages. Range: 1 to 3600 (Sec).

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationDecisionThresh.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationDecisionThresholds
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationDecisionThresh.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the setting of thresholds for the rate decision algorithm. high (2) should typically be used when the SNR is lower than 13dB.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationHistorySize.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationHistorySize
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationHistorySize.description: Applicable to all units with HW version C or higher. This value is used to compute the transmission time. Not used in version 6.0 and higher.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationPacketThreshol.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationPacketThresholdToTestUpRate
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationPacketThreshol.description: Applicable to all units with HW version C or higher. When the number of transmitted frames exceeds this number the upper modulations will be tested.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationPacketNoOnUppe.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationPacketNoOnUpperRate
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationPacketNoOnUppe.description: Applicable to all units with HW version C or higher. The number of frames used on upper modulations.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationAlgorithm.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationAlgorithm
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationAlgorithm.description: Applicable to all units with HW version C or higher. Defines the adaptive modulation algorithm used by the unit.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationRetriesOnLower.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationRetriesOnLowerModulations
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationRetriesOnLower.description: Applicable to all units with HW version C or higher. It allows retransmissions at lower modulation levels.

brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationRTSDurationMod.name: brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationRTSDurationMode
brzaccVLAdaptiveModulationRTSDurationMod.description: Applicable to all units with HW version C or higher. It defines the mode to calculate the value for RTS duration field.

brzaccVLBurstModeOption.name: brzaccVLBurstModeOption
brzaccVLBurstModeOption.description: Applicable to all units. Applicable only if Burst Mode Option is supported by country specific parameters of the Sub Band. Not applicable if Wireless Link Prioritization is enabled. Enables/disable burst mode operation. In SU/RB with HW Revision B or lower blocked(3) value is returned when Security Mode is Wep , Data Encryption Option is Enabled and Burst option is Enabled. In AU/BU with HW Revision B or lower blocked(3) value is returned when Dfs Option is Enabled and Burst mode is enabled.

brzaccVLBurstInterval.name: brzaccVLBurstInterval
brzaccVLBurstInterval.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable if Wireless Link Prioritization is enabled. Burst mode interval in milliseconds. Range: 1 to the maximum value as defined in the country specific parameters of the Sub Band (milliseconds).

brzaccVLConcatenationOption.name: brzaccVLConcatenationOption
brzaccVLConcatenationOption.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the Concatenation option.

brzaccVLConcatenationMaximumNumberOfFram.name: brzaccVLConcatenationMaximumNumberOfFrames
brzaccVLConcatenationMaximumNumberOfFram.description: Applicable to all units with SW version 3.X . Not applicable for version 4.0 and higher. Defines the maximum numbers of frames that can be concatenated. Range:2 to 8 (frames).

brzaccVLConcatenationMaxFrameSize.name: brzaccVLConcatenationMaxFrameSize
brzaccVLConcatenationMaxFrameSize.description: Applicable to all units. Defines the maximum size of a concatenated frame. Range: 256 to 2200 (bytes) for BreezeNET-B products BU/RB14 BU/RB28, or for AU/SU with HW revision A or B. 256 to 4032 (bytes) for AU/SU with HW Revision C or higher, BreezeNET-B products BU/RB100 and BreezeNET-B products BU/RB10.

brzaccVLControlModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLControlModulationLevel
brzaccVLControlModulationLevel.description: Applicable to all units wits software version 6.0 and higher. The modulation level for control frames. basicRates(1) means the all control frames will be sent at basic rate and modulationLevel1(2) means the all control frames will be sent at modulation level 1

brzaccVLEthernetFrameSize.name: brzaccVLEthernetFrameSize
brzaccVLEthernetFrameSize.description: Applicable only for BNB-10 products. The maximum frame size used on Ethernet port.

brzaccVLRunningEthernetFrameSize.name: brzaccVLRunningEthernetFrameSize
brzaccVLRunningEthernetFrameSize.description: Applicable only for BNB-10 products. The frame size used on Ethernet port.

brzaccVLAverageReceiveSNR.name: brzaccVLAverageReceiveSNR
brzaccVLAverageReceiveSNR.description: Applicable to SU/RB only. The average Signal to Noise Ratio of received frames.

brzaccVLResetTrafficCounters.name: brzaccVLResetTrafficCounters
brzaccVLResetTrafficCounters.description: Applicable to all units. Resets the traffic counters.

brzaccVLResetPerModulationLevelCounters.name: brzaccVLResetPerModulationLevelCounters
brzaccVLResetPerModulationLevelCounters.description: Applicable to all units. Resets the per-Modulation Level counters .

brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTabl.name: brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTable
brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTabl.description: Applicable to SU/RB. Per Rate Counters table.

brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersEntr.name: brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersEntry
brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersEntr.description: Applicable to SU/RB. An entry in the Per modulation Counters table.

brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTabl.name: brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTableIdx
brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTabl.description: Applicable to SU/RB. An index of an entry in the Per modulation level Counters table.

brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersAppl.name: brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersApplicableModLevel
brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersAppl.description: Applicable to SU/RB. The applicable modulation level of the entry in the Per modulation level Counters table. Modulation Level 8 is not applicable for units with HW revision A.

brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTxSu.name: brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTxSuccess
brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTxSu.description: Applicable to SU/RB. The total number of successfully transmitted unicasts at the applicable modulation level.

brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTxFa.name: brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTxFailed
brzaccVLSUPerModulationLevelCountersTxFa.description: Applicable to SU/RB. The total number of dropped frames at the applicable Modulation Level.

brzaccVLAverageModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLAverageModulationLevel
brzaccVLAverageModulationLevel.description: Applicable to SU/RB. The average modulation level for successful transmission (rounded to nearest integer) since last reset of the Per Modulation Level counters. Range: 1 to 8.

brzaccVLTotalRxFramesViaEthernet.name: brzaccVLTotalRxFramesViaEthernet
brzaccVLTotalRxFramesViaEthernet.description: Applicable to all units. Total number of frames received via the Ethernet port.

brzaccVLTxWirelessToEthernet.name: brzaccVLTxWirelessToEthernet
brzaccVLTxWirelessToEthernet.description: Applicable to all units. Total number of frames transmitted to the Ethernet port.

brzaccVLAUBeaconsToWireless.name: brzaccVLAUBeaconsToWireless
brzaccVLAUBeaconsToWireless.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The number of beacons transmitted to the wireless media.

brzaccVLDataAndOtherMngFramesToWireless.name: brzaccVLDataAndOtherMngFramesToWireless
brzaccVLDataAndOtherMngFramesToWireless.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The number of data and management frames transmitted to the wireless media. The count includes one count for each data frame transmitted successfully (excluding retransmissions).

brzaccVLTotalTxFramesToWireless.name: brzaccVLTotalTxFramesToWireless
brzaccVLTotalTxFramesToWireless.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames transmitted to the wireless media. The count includes one count for each data frame that was transmitted successfully (excluding retransmissions), and also the number of transmitted control and management frames, including beacons.

brzaccVLTotalTransmittedUnicasts.name: brzaccVLTotalTransmittedUnicasts
brzaccVLTotalTransmittedUnicasts.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The total number of unicast frames successfully transmitted to the wireless media, excluding retransmissions.

brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFram.name: brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFramesDouble
brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFram.description: Applicable to all products. The total number of double concatenated frames successfully transmitted to the wireless media, excluding retransmissions.

brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFram.name: brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFramesSingle
brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFram.description: Applicable to all products. The total number of double concatenated frames successfully transmitted to the wireless media, excluding retransmissions.

brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFram.name: brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFramesMore
brzaccVLTotalTransmittedConcatenatedFram.description: Applicable to all products. The total number of concatenated frames with more then two frames successfully transmitted to the wireless media, excluding retransmissions.

brzaccVLTotalRxFramesFromWireless.name: brzaccVLTotalRxFramesFromWireless
brzaccVLTotalRxFramesFromWireless.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of frames that were received from the wireless media. The count includes data and control and management frames, including beacons received from the AU/BU. The count does not include frames that were discarded internally, bad frames and duplicate frames.

brzaccVLTotalRetransmittedFrames.name: brzaccVLTotalRetransmittedFrames
brzaccVLTotalRetransmittedFrames.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of retransmissions of data frames (counts all unsuccessful transmissions/retransmissions).

brzaccVLFramesDropped.name: brzaccVLFramesDropped
brzaccVLFramesDropped.description: Applicable to all units. The number of dropped frames. The frames that were retransmitted to the extent of the maximum allowed number of retransmissions without being acknowledged..

brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaHighQueue.name: brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaHighQueue
brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaHighQueue.description: Applicable to all units. Frames submitted to the internal bridge via the High priority queue. for transmission to the wireless media.

brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaMidQueue.name: brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaMidQueue
brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaMidQueue.description: Applicable to all units. Frames submitted to the internal bridge via the Mid priority queue for transmission to the wireless media.

brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaLowQueue.name: brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaLowQueue
brzaccVLFramesSubmittedViaLowQueue.description: Applicable to all units. Frames submitted to the internal bridge via the Low priority queue for transmission to the wireless media.

brzaccVLTotalNoOfDataFramesSubmitted.name: brzaccVLTotalNoOfDataFramesSubmitted
brzaccVLTotalNoOfDataFramesSubmitted.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of data frames submitted to the internal bridge for transmission to the wireless media.

brzaccVLTotalRecievedDataFrames.name: brzaccVLTotalRecievedDataFrames
brzaccVLTotalRecievedDataFrames.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of data frames received from the wireless media, including duplicate frames.

brzaccVLRecievedBadFrames.name: brzaccVLRecievedBadFrames
brzaccVLRecievedBadFrames.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames received from the wireless media with errors (CRC errors).

brzaccVLNoOfDuplicateFramesDiscarded.name: brzaccVLNoOfDuplicateFramesDiscarded
brzaccVLNoOfDuplicateFramesDiscarded.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames discarded due to receiving multiple copies.

brzaccVLNoOfInternallyDiscardedMirCir.name: brzaccVLNoOfInternallyDiscardedMirCir
brzaccVLNoOfInternallyDiscardedMirCir.description: Applicable to all units. The number of data frames received from the Ethernet port that were discarded by the MIR/CIR mechanism either to avoid exceeding the maximum allowed information rate, or when the wireless link conditions do not enable reaching the allowed rate.

brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesDouble.name: brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesDouble
brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesDouble.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of double concatenated frames received from the wireless media, including duplicate frames.

brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesSingle.name: brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesSingle
brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesSingle.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of data fast frames single concatenated frames received from the wireless media, including duplicate frames.

brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesMore.name: brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesMore
brzaccVLTotalRxConcatenatedFramesMore.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of data fast frames concatenated with more then two frames received from the wireless media, including duplicate frames.

brzaccVLTXRetransmissionPercentage.name: brzaccVLTXRetransmissionPercentage
brzaccVLTXRetransmissionPercentage.description: Applicable to all units. Indicates the percentage of frames that have been retransmitted.

brzaccVLRXCRCPercentage.name: brzaccVLRXCRCPercentage
brzaccVLRXCRCPercentage.description: Applicable to all units. Indicates the percentage of received frames with CRC error.

brzaccVLDroppedFrameEvents.name: brzaccVLDroppedFrameEvents
brzaccVLDroppedFrameEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames that were dropped because they were retransmitted to the maximum allowed number of retransmissions without being acknowledged.

brzaccVLFramesDelayedDueToSwRetry.name: brzaccVLFramesDelayedDueToSwRetry
brzaccVLFramesDelayedDueToSwRetry.description: Applicable to all units. Not applicable for units with SW Version 3.0 and higher. The number of frames that were delayed because the SW retry algorithm was activated on a previous frame designated for the same recipient.

brzaccVLUnderrunEvents.name: brzaccVLUnderrunEvents
brzaccVLUnderrunEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames whose transmission was aborted because the rate of submitting frames for transmission exceeded the available transmission capability.

brzaccVLOthersTxEvents.name: brzaccVLOthersTxEvents
brzaccVLOthersTxEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The number of Tx events due to problems other than those of the other Tx Events counters.

brzaccVLTotalTxEvents.name: brzaccVLTotalTxEvents
brzaccVLTotalTxEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of Tx special events.

brzaccVLPhyErrors.name: brzaccVLPhyErrors
brzaccVLPhyErrors.description: Applicable to all units, only when DFS is enabled. The number of unidentified signals.

brzaccVLCRCErrors.name: brzaccVLCRCErrors
brzaccVLCRCErrors.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames received from the wireless media containing CRC errors.

brzaccVLOverrunEvents.name: brzaccVLOverrunEvents
brzaccVLOverrunEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames that were discarded because the receive rate exceeded the processing capability or the capacity of the Ethernet port.

brzaccVLRxDecryptEvents.name: brzaccVLRxDecryptEvents
brzaccVLRxDecryptEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The number of frames that were not received properly due to a problem in the data decryption mechanism.

brzaccVLTotalRxEvents.name: brzaccVLTotalRxEvents
brzaccVLTotalRxEvents.description: Applicable to all units. The total number of Rx special events.

brzaccVLAUAdbResetAllModulationLevelCoun.name: brzaccVLAUAdbResetAllModulationLevelCounters
brzaccVLAUAdbResetAllModulationLevelCoun.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. To reset all the counters for all SUs/RB in the MAC Address Database.

brzaccVLAUAdbTable.name: brzaccVLAUAdbTable
brzaccVLAUAdbTable.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. AU/BU MAC Address Database table.

brzaccVLAUAdbEntry.name: brzaccVLAUAdbEntry
brzaccVLAUAdbEntry.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. An entry in the AU/BU MAC Address Database table.

brzaccVLAdbIndex.name: brzaccVLAdbIndex
brzaccVLAdbIndex.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The index of an entry in the AU/BU MAC Address Database table.

brzaccVLAdbMacAddress.name: brzaccVLAdbMacAddress
brzaccVLAdbMacAddress.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The MAC Address of an SU/RB entry in the MAC Address Database table.

brzaccVLAdbStatus.name: brzaccVLAdbStatus
brzaccVLAdbStatus.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The status of the relevant SU/RB.

brzaccVLAdbSwVersion.name: brzaccVLAdbSwVersion
brzaccVLAdbSwVersion.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The SW version of the relevant SU/RB. Not available for SU-EZ.

brzaccVLAdbSNR.name: brzaccVLAdbSNR
brzaccVLAdbSNR.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The average Signal to Noise Ratio in dB of frames received by the AU/BU from the relevant SU/RB.

brzaccVLAdbMaxModulationLevel.name: brzaccVLAdbMaxModulationLevel
brzaccVLAdbMaxModulationLevel.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. The value configured in the relevant SU/RB for the Maximum Modulation Level parameter. Modulation Level 8 is not applicable for units with HW revision A. It is not applicable for SU-EZ and it returns na.

brzaccVLAdbTxFramesTotal.name: brzaccVLAdbTxFramesTotal
brzaccVLAdbTxFramesTotal.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link.

brzaccVLAdbDroppedFramesTotal.name: brzaccVLAdbDroppedFramesTotal
brzaccVLAdbDroppedFramesTotal.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of frames intended to the SU/RB that were dropped because they were retransmitted to the extent of the maximum allowed number of retransmissions without being acknowledged.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel1.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel1
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel1.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link using modulation level 1.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel2.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel2
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel2.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link using modulation level 2.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel3.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel3
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel3.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/BU over the wireless link using modulation level 3.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel4.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel4
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel4.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link using modulation level 4.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel5.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel5
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel5.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link using modulation level 5.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel6.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel6
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel6.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/BU over the wireless link using modulation level 6.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel7.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel7
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel7.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link using modulation level 7.

brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel8.name: brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel8
brzaccVLAdbTxSuccessModLevel8.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of unicast frames (excluding retransmissions) that were successfully transmitted to the SU/RB over the wireless link using modulation level 8. Not applicable for units with HW revision A.

brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel1.name: brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel1
brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel1.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of failures to successfully transmit unicast frames intended to the SU/RB using modulation level 1.

brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel2.name: brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel2
brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel2.description: Applicable to AU/BU only. Counts the total number of failures to successfully transmit unicast frames intended to the SU/RB using modulation level 2.

brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel3.name: brzaccVLAdbTxFailedModLevel3
